Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: deirdre_lawlor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for those arriving in Rome by train as its just around the corner from the main train station. Also, if your travelling around Rome by bus, there are bus stops just outside the door. We got the bus to the Vatican but give yourself plenty of time as traffic can be manic! Breakfast is really nice for European, especially the Hot choc and crossiants. 2 computers to use for internet access down beside the reception, which is really handy for booking tours etc. Definately book Vatican museum tour and Colloseum tours in advance! Bedroom is old world but everything you need is there and bathroom was newly redecorated. I requested a room overlooking garden (less noisy) and I got it! Great spot for a wedding too!

Reviews.Title: “Snooty Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: liz h
Reviews.Content: There are a couple of really snooty men who work the reception desks and guests do need to stick up for themselves if there is a problem. However most of the other staff are really obliging and helpful. The hotel is clean and comfortable and in easy walking distance of all of the main attractions in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “faded but not gone entirely”
Reviews.Author: annablast
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel april 5 to april 10 2012. I stayed here in 1965 as a young woman with husband and children and thought that it would be nostalgic being alone to revisit this hotel. First memories do get distorted but I remember lots of gold on shoulders of door men and elegant surroundings and people who were immensely helpful. Wonderful breakfast in the garden with freshly squeezed blood orange, piano playing and the sense of elegance . All of that has gone. Little plastic chairs and tables, breakfast perfectly adquate, the ubiquitous scrambled egg, bacon, weiner sausage, pastries, bread coffee tea etc. eggs prepared in different ways could be ordered at a certain cost. I had just flown in from the west coast of Canada and was looking forward to an elegant room in old fashioned surroundings. The first room I was shown would not have even suited a cloistered Nun.. see room 209... should not even be rented... I returned to the desk and said that I could not possibly stay there and so was given another key with the advice that if that did not suit I was to return.. Well this room was comfortable... especially by comparison.. it did not look over the small courtyard garden but by this time I was glad to just have a spacious room. Rm 236. The room was clean, the beds hard... the bathroom warm and the water hot. The location of course is superb the people at the desk during the day were very helpful, never saw the rather surly first guy again., there is internet and machines in the foyer for use. Room was cleaned late in the day. Would I stay there again? probably not. But for the location perhaps yes, altho there are lots of good looking hotels in the same area. There is a bus stop just opposite and the metro is half a block down the street. It is within walking distance of Termini and all those hop on off buses.

Reviews.Title: “What do you like about This Hotel i really dont get..”
Reviews.Author: Drufukbasoglusonmez
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is too old, rooms are small, breakfast is about of 2 kinds of cheese and bacon. I really dont understand how people liked it here. The only thing fine is the localization thats all. The shampoo even had not been changed while the the room had cleaned. What else?? I think thats enough.. Hopefully i will visit Rome too many times but never going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fourteen Years Later”
Reviews.Author: Pimento
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first stayed here on our honeymoon 14 years ago. I am happy to say that it remains a great place to stay while in Rome. The location is fantastic- easy walking distance to multiple areas of the city. The breakfast is also good, the best part being a fantastic self-serve coffee maker. No limit on the number of cappucinos or espressos you may have prior to hitting the pavement for sight seeing! Lovely. WiFi access is available but a bit spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Great, authentic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Erica K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had a wonderful experience. All of the staff was so friendly and helpful. Our room was charming, beautiful and really large-especially by European standards. Anytime we needed anything, they were happy to oblige. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go except the Vatican-and the hotel called a cab for us. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, close to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: angela c
Reviews.Content: The Quirinale is a busy hotel within walking distance of the Spanish steps and excellent shops. Our room was large with a very high ceiling and window, so typical of Italian interiors. Not luxuriously furnished but adequate for our needs as we spent little time in the room. There was no coffee station (most Italian hotels are now following this trend - something to do with health and safety !) but, more shocking was the fact that you had to "pay to view" for the television. I think it was 24 euros for the day, a little steep I would say considering that the hotel, being a four star, was already rather pricey. Staff were friendly and accommodating and the buffet breakfast was good. Angela C Bridgend South Wales

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! (Allergic travelers & Easter Holiday)”
Reviews.Author: Yadys S
Reviews.Content: Location wise this hotel is perfect! walk distance from the main attractions (spanish steps, old roman ruins and trevi fountain. The nearest metro station is about 2 minute walk and just 3 stops away from Vatican City. The hotel is very pretty. The rooms are incredible huge for a 4* hotel but must confess it is not the cleanest hotel ever and it is also very old furniture. Im an incredibly allergic person which means that this hotel was quite a nightmare for me, as soon as i entered the room my nose got blocked, but my boyfriend didn't had a problem so maybe it is just me or other allergic persons.Overall the staff are very nice. Good channels on free TV, internet worked perfectly, no problems. If you are allergic, just bring your medicines... overall the hotel is perfect and super worth it!! PS: If you are going to Rome in Easter book everything with a lot of time in advance!! Even entrance for every museum or attraction. During this period Rome is worst than Disney world in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Quirinale Roma”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Roma. You are greeted with the spirit of Rome. The staff are highly professional and cater to their guest. The rooms are quite rustic, representing the old Roma of the 17th and 18th century. The garden court yard is a must see and dine in. It host all the pleasures of fine cuisine in their dinning areas. The hotel is located in the center of Roma. It's only a few blocks from the Roma massive transit system. You can buy a pass for the hop on hop off access bus that will take you all over Rome. It is also located on one the main shopping streets. It's a must stay for me when I return to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice authentic hotel, lovely big room & massive bathroom”
Reviews.Author: OrgasmicCry
Reviews.Content: Lovely place, and in Rome pretty much any central location enjoys beautiful walks through winding city streets. Despite being on a busy street traffic noise was never an issue. It has a stunningly beautiful tea room with what must be 10metre ceilings. Had to pay for Internet/wireless though, how very 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Adelchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Rooms were clean and roomy. However rooms were old and very stuffy. We had to open the window for fresh air but being on the lower level we couldn't always keep it open for security reasons! There was no iron which made it hard, u could op to have it ironed by the staff but it was expensive. Breakfast was very good. Great range of food. Walking distance to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Lovely charm but avoid the standard rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Tami P
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for three nights. The hotel itself is located in a brillant part of the city which is central to most things. In Rome it is easy to walk everywhere. The hotel is situated in one of the main shopping streets and is about 15 to 20 mins walk from every sight you could want to see. The hotel itself is clean and welcoming, the issue was with our room. Although clean we had a standard room and I would not recomend it and pay more for a suite. Our room was tiny and the window had no view and was overlooking the roof of the restaurant. The bathroom looked impressive but completely inpractical with the shower. The shower was over the bath but instead of at either end it was placed in the middle which meant that it was aimed right over the bath onto the floor. There was a shower curtain but unless you are super small and skinny it is imposible to shower without having a fight with the shower curtain as you had no room and it meant the water ended up on the floor each day. Second problem with the shower was that there was hardly any water pressure so took forever to wash suds away. Third problem with the shower was that you had three choices, freezing cold, barely luke warm or scorching hot. I actually burtnt my scalp the first morning and i like hot showers but this was kettle hot and dangerous! So, shower a BIG problem. The hotel allows smokers in the rooms, this was a shock as our room smelt constantly of smoke each day as it seemed every one in our corridor smoked, as non smokers this was annoying. What worried me the most though was that our window did not lock close and we were overlooking a flat roof, everyones windows overlooked this and at any time someone could climb out of their window into our room and vice versa as there was no way to close the window, one morning we actually heard someone moving around out there and it was very scary! In short, the location was fantastic and the hotel offered so much but the lows were so low that I would not recomend or stay here again, I wish it was different as it was a beautiful hotel, prehaps the suites are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly faded grandeur, characterful, spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Heather255
Reviews.Content: We'd asked for a quiet twin room at the back and were given room 537, an enormous corner room overlooking a side street, with a huge bathroom. Unfortunately it was stifling hot because of underfloor hot-water pipes, and the air-conditioning was not yet operational on 21 March, so we had to have the (double-glazed) window open all night but it was terribly noisy. We asked to change rooms and were moved to 538 which wasn't actually next door but at the back overlooking the garden, with french windows onto a delightful balcony. Smaller but nicer, lovely bathroom with opening window, just as comfortable and still twice the size of the average city hotel with bags of character too. Furniture in both rooms was v old-fashioned, quite fancy and impressive but rather battered though this just added to the character. The beds are very firm, there's a minibar but no beverage tray, good tv. Breakfast was included, a wide self-selection buffet including everything you could possibly think of plus a good help-yourself coffee machine and even teapots in which to brew your choice of quality tea! In Italy! Staff pleasant and helpful, very well trained, smart and self-effacing. Housekeeping was immaculate, couldn't have been cleaner, the impression was that everybody was proud of their hotel. Really our only gripe, which seems a bit churlish, was that we were given clean towels and sheets daily and couldn't elect to save the planet and use them again.

Reviews.Title: “within walking distance to rain transportation”
Reviews.Author: LatriciaB
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Quirinale for it's location. We traveled by train and we could simply walk to the hotel. Traffic is a little crazy in this area, but a traveler can connect to many attractions with ease. Loved the old style rooms. We had a top floor with a huge balcony. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: notuslimited
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 21 March 2012. Room on the 5th floor was a bit of a trek but quite pleasantly surprised with the room. Very nice old world feel with a nice little balcony. Bed was comfortable. The only drawback was the power shower had taken the day off when I used it but I guess this is not surprising given the age of the hotel. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore idiot reviews”
Reviews.Author: sccarlin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older, but that only means rooms that are larger and much more comfortable than newer European and Italian hotels. The location is fabulous for touring the ruins and museums. The staff was helpful and efficient, even if they did not try to be our close personal friends, HIV other reviewers seem o expect. Now for the idiots. Those who omplain of " pay tv only" do not know how to operate a remote. There is a TV button to push because the tv starts by default at the pay movie menu (just like U.S. hotels!). Likewise, the wifi internet requires a device-specific code. Then itworks fine. The room service was actually good, when our son wanted a late night snack. This place was a great value and we would gladly come back. Before yourip a place, please use your brain.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clanks76 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome and this hotel was lovely. Old so very in fitting with the surroundings and decor to a high standard. Right next to train and metro so very good location. Good restaurants near buy and easy to get to all the sites. Only downfall was that the rooms were very warm (and I'm usually cold!) they have the cold air from the aircon turned off in winter but really needs to be kept on. You can open the windows but too much traffic noise to keep open at night. This would not stop me returning to this hotel though!!

Reviews.Title: “Roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: Maureen_Dub
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed in the excellent Quirinale in Feb 2012. Location is perfect for a holiday in Rome. The bus termini is about 5 or 10 minutes away - and there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. The restaurants in the immediate area are very good and there are two Irish pubs on the street. The hotel itself is lovely. The rooms are really spacious (superior rooms that is, which cost a bit more than the standard rooms). Windows can be opened. The bathrooms are spacious. Breakfast is an excellent buffet from 6 am to 10 am. We would all heartily recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A fading hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Janiefeelgood59
Reviews.Content: We had a five night stay here. The rooms are adequate. No tea & coffee facilities in rooms & the in room internet did not work. Breakfasts were good. A crowd of 20 of us had dinner in the hotel which was spot on, it was delicous, well presented & very good value, & the staff were polite & friendly. We were the only ones eating in the hotel & it was a Saturday evening. The hotel recommended several restaurants for us to 'try' - all of which were horrendously expensive. Try to find restaurants where the locals eat- you will save hundreds of euros, and the food is just as good if not better!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, old world charm.”
Reviews.Author: Carlsberg P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Quirinale February 10 - 12, 2012. I absolutely loved it! The hotel has the old world charm that a hotel in Rome should have. My room was large with a high ceiling, with a huge bed and proper antique furnishings. The flat screen tv looked out of place. The bathroom had a massive sink and massive cast iron roll top bath. The bath was so big that I floated away when I leaned back!! If you want white walls and minimalist furnishings, this isn't the place for you. If you want old world elegance, then book it now. I, for one, cannot wait to stay here again. Nearly forgot to mention the staff!, who were all absolutely wonderful and couldn't do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “A little faded from past glories, but a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Teiresias
Reviews.Content: Massive pile of a place in a fantasitc location - about 10 minutes from Termini, and an easy walk to the sights, good service from the staff, decent breakfast, and free wifi Only downer was the lack of availability of ironing services - I had work shirts that I needed to iron after unpacking, and couldn't borrow an iron. I had to put the shirts through their laundry service which was irritating.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, in a great location at the right $$$”
Reviews.Author: JimJ5104
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome on business for 6 days and stayed at the 4 star Hotel Quirinale. The location, for me was excellent. It was near the center of Rome, 1 block from a main metro station and 2 blocks from the train station. Easy to walk to all of the monuments in Rome, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps even the Vatican. The good part was it was on Via Nazionale which is loaded with everyday shopping (not the stuff you can't afford like on the via Condotti). The hotel is old but elegant and the staff is great, all english speaking and very helpful. The heating and plumbing were a bit of a challange but that is part of the ambiance. The room I had was good size and the bath was impecable, clean, all white tile. TV was a flat screen with many channels and good reception. The wireless was strong and free. After a long day at work this was a great place to return to. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Returning to the Hotel Quirinale for the last ten years”
Reviews.Author: rita a
Reviews.Content: My husband, our daughter and I return to Rome every year to spend Christmas there. We have returned to the Hotel Quirinale every year for the last ten years. Wonderful hotel! Truly elegant and old world tradition. Excellent service. Very clean. Centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Ten years Returning to the Same Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: The personnel are very helpful and accommodating. The location is great, centrally located, but not clogged with traffic. I loved having breakfast in the garden and drinks in the grand lobby. The place feels like an 19th century palace, complete with paintings in the public spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm and central location...all good!”
Reviews.Author: William C
Reviews.Content: Not a US 5-star chain hotel...accept the fact that things are different in Europe than Cleveland...everything you need, spacious rooms and walking distance to anything you need. A good place to begin your Italian sojourn...

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: fightingirish101
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very elegant and classic. It was very quiet when we stayed and not much atmosphere. The restaurant is quite restrained. But we got excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business or leisure in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CotswoldFish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Via Nazionale, quite near to Rome's main train station and about 40 mins drive from the Fumicino airport. It's in a good location in a safe part of Rome, about 15 mins walk from the Trevi fountain and other popular tourist sites - the Collosseum is just down the road (turn left out the hotel, then turn left on via Serpenti and you'll see it in front of you). The Parthenon and Spanish Steps are walkable as well, and I took a stroll up to the Villa Medici on a nice sunny morning during my stay. The hotel itself is well appointed and the staff are friendly and helpful; although I speak Italian, all the front desk staff are multi-lingual and most of them speak English. It's a deceptively large hotel and my room was at the end of a long corridor - it's one of those old buildings with very high ceilings, but has been modernised over the years. My room was nice and quiet as it looked out over a courtyard/covered building at the rear of the hotel; it should be noted though that rooms at the front of the hotel can be very noisy due to the busy road outside. The rooms are a bit stuffy as well, so if you have to open a window it'll get even more noisy. Ask for a room away from the road and you'll be fine. There's a large, grand salon room downstairs near reception with a roaring fire where you can sit and have a beer or a coffee, and there's a restaurant on site. I have to say I wasn't very impressed with the food at the restaurant; I like my pasta al dente but the starter that we had was undercooked, with a white flouriness in the middle. I would class the food as average. Anyway, there are many, many restaurants within an easy walk of this hotel, so this isn't a huge problem. Facilities in the hotel are good. There's a small gym downstairs, free for guest use, and there's free wi-fi for all guests (just ask for a password at reception). One minor disappointment is that there are no irons/ironing boards in any of the rooms due to fire regulations - if you want a shirt pressed, you'll have to get the hotel laundry to do it for you (and pay accordingly). Overall this is a very good hotel whether you're visiting for business or pleasure. A few minor quibbles aside, I'd definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: plum93
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights this summer. Beautiful hotel. Room and bathroom were very large. Breakfast buffet was great with a lot of choices. Very nice courtyard to eat breakfast at. Very good location - tons of restaurants and gelato shops and a short walk to the Trevi and Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but the lobby need an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Doudin P
Reviews.Content: Stay 4 nights. Good hotel on a noisy street near Termini Station. Rooms on the garden side are quiet and large. Nice furniture. Good service and excellent buffet for the breakfast. The hotel had a better time. The lobby is dark and need a serious upgrade. Limousine of the hotel to the airport at the same price than a taxi. But will come back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay and great location!”
Reviews.Author: hellopeggylo
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a friend who stayed here years ago. We were in Rome during Christmas holidays (which is considered the low season). The front desk staff were professional and friendly. The page boy was very nice. Our junior room had a garden view and it's quite. Everyday we came back from our day trip we could smell the fresh linen in our room and it's so pleasing. Breakfast was excellent, with great selections of food. The dining room chandeliers were spectacular. Many wonderful restaurants hidden in the back alley behind the hotel just 3-5 mins walking distance. There is free wi-fi in the hotel, however, you need to obtain a password from the front desk and it's only good for 24 hours; internet connection is very slow in this hotel and could be a huge downside for some people. Since we were here for vacation and consistently out and about, we didn't mind the slow internet connection. The entire hotel is full of old world charm. Nothing modern. Which is exact what we were looking for. We also met another couple from NYC who's being staying in this hotel every year for more than a decade. I believe that speaks for everything about this place. I consider myself have a very high standard on services. This place had exceed my expectation. Next time when we visit Rome, we will certainly stay at Hotel Quirinale again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koomaros Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I stay on Quirinale hotel and, for sure, I'll stay again once in Rome. I like the rooms, the courtesy of the whole staff, the location and the air "fin de siècle" very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Joanna P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quirinale for five nights in late November, and could not have asked for better service or location. The superior room was huge by city centre standards, and very elegant and comfortable. We walked practically everywhere as it's approx 20 mins on foot from the major piazzas and landmarks, and also just minutes from the Termini and metro. The staff were helpful and obliging, providing everything we needed with a smile, even when I needed an adapter for my mobile charger. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Solid average”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTraveler7
Reviews.Content: We made these reservations from home and spent extra for a "nicer" room but we were sorely disappointed. Although the facility itself clearly has potential for grandeur, the service and amenities fell far short of our expectations. The "king" sized bed was actually two twins shoved together, and they didn't stay together - so we had to be careful not to fall into the gully at night. The pillows were cheap and stiff and the shower was barely a trickle. The breakfast was so-so, the staff clearly overworked, and the service impersonal. I can't honestly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable old classic”
Reviews.Author: beachperls Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, but you can see how elegant it may have been long time ago. Everything must be put in perspective. Compared to many hotels in Rome, Quirinale offers very much space. Rooms and lobby are relatively big. Superior room was way to big, but the normal room is probably just enough. Both of my visits the rooms and baths were very clean. The bed was very good and clean. The reception staff is friendly and good. Location is very convenient to many attractions and down town. Unfortunately the breakfast is below my expectation. Food is OK and clean. It is just a very bad setting and breakfast staff is unmotivated and no service motivation at all. Also the breakfast room is to small and it gets packed very often. I recommend this hotel as a very consistent and if you pay bellow 200 Euro reasonably priced hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great central location/disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Lizzieshrewsbury
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed when shown our room - very small with outlook onto refuse area. As we were booked in for 5 nights we asked and were given an upgrade to a bigger room( Room no 134). The bathroom was dated - shower over bath didn't work properly and the water temperature unpredictable. The hand-held separate shower head was the saving grace. Poor quality bath products. Towels poor. No tea/coffee making facility in room (apparantly due to safety issues - which is a joke when you consider the electric socket next to the sink in the bathroom!) No iron/ironing board for the same reason - the room did not meet 4 star expectation. (incidently I got badly bitten by mosquitoes - as it was november I didn't for one minute think to take plug-ins and bite cream) - however is was unseasonably warm and humid) Public rooms were very grand and spacious. Beautiful courtyard garden - an oasis in such a busy city! Breakfast which was "free" was more than adequate. Hot and cold food. Location excellent for metro and walking to places of interest. Hotel bar expensive but then all hotels bars are. European prices are generally high especially restaurants but overall the food everywhere was very good. Many restaurants close to the hotel. If there is one place I would highly recommend it would be the Cornucopia in the Trasvestere area (a few minutes walk from the Tiber Island) - we spent a whole afternoon here celebrating my birthday - the food was absolutely delicious and the service superb! (Italian waiters best in the world!) One of the many things that impressed my about Rome is its sense of self-identity eg most of the reaturants are italian - very few cosmopolitan places. Shopping to die for - don't be afraid to ask for discount - I bought 2 pairs of boots and got over 100 euros off! This was our first visit to Rome and will definitely return - but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DamonF12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of November 2011. It is ideally situated with close walking distance to most of the sites. Breakfast was great, the rooms were great and the staff were very helpful and welcoming. Prices for restaurant and bar are not cheap but relative to the prices of a major European city hotel. There are some lovely restaurants close by to chose from too. Would defiantly recommend, and would go back here no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Quirinale, via Nazionale 7, Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandsKiki
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a five night four day holiday. The hotel is clean and the service is friendly. The breakfast was nice with a hot entree, cereal and fruit. There is a lovely indoor courtyard, bar and formal sitting area. My main issue was a room located on the fourth floor with access by an old elevator encased in a cage. If the doors are not shut properly you have to walk four flights up or down the stairs. The room was noisy, and there was no AC, but you could not open the windows because of the street noise. We did find many restaurants nearby, and there is lots of shopping on the street. No concierge service. Internet service is sub-par, requiring daily codes, and it is not very reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed for a delightful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NYPatsy
Reviews.Content: My parents (ages 80, 79 & I'm 40) and I just spent a lovely week at the Quirinale. The staff was friendly and helpful, great dinner recommendations! We has 2 rooms on the 5th floor, I've attached photos of my room. Very grand, tall ceilings, one large window in the bedroom area and one smaller but still rather larger window in the bathroom. Very clean, roomy, comfortable, and the bed was a true queen, not two twins pushed together as seems to be the norm in Europe. Having read some of the other reviews I would agree that this is an older hotel, but it's not rundown. I've never had the pleasure of staying in a Ritz or Waldorf, so I can't compare on that level. This is a lovely, older, very clean, comfortable hotel, in a great location with regards to walking and connecting with tour buses, the main train station and the metro. We did not take the train or the metro but I saw entrances to both during our stay. Our rooms were both street facing, the windows, while older, are almost sound proof! Breakfast was included with the rooms and it was tasty and plentiful, tables were hard to come by after 9:30 but the staff was super efficient about clearing up! All in all I will stay here again if I return to Rome. The hotel staff was helpful before we even arrived and arranged for a car to collect us at the airport for 68 Euros, made most sense to us rather than trying to get our act together after an over night flight into a foreign country in which none of us spoke the language. Oh, the staff has a solid command of English, but my rusty French came in handy more than once.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, close to a lot”
Reviews.Author: runninggirlEssex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for one night recently, for the second time. This is a large hotel and has a certain "old world" charm. The room I had was clean and large, again with a certain charm. However it was baking hot and I had to open the window, which was fine as I was at the back, but if you had a room at the front I would imagine it would be noisy. The bed was reasonably comfortable but the pillows were like stones!! Breakfast was fine. Location is first rate, right on via Nazionale and within walking distance of many sights and restaurants. I would stay here on holiday but probably could not afford it!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natasha T
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6, including 3 children stayed at the quirinale for three days. The location is quite good, although I think the wrong end of Via Nazionale and I don't really like being close to the Termini. Two of our three rooms were very spacious and overlooked the garden courtyard, they were a bit "tired", but clean. The third room was "very tired" and a bit grubby and very small. We found most of the staff to be polite but not friendly and we found the breakfasts to be very average and the waiting staff to be rude and cold. We found that the hotel catered for an older clientele and perhaps was not as family friendly, even though our children range in age from 10-16 years. The Quirinale wasn't a "bad" hotel, we just didn't enjoy the experience as much as other trips we have had to Rome. There seemed to be a large number of tour groups staying at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Marguerite40
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend Hotel Quirinale. We were a group of 8 friends who had booked for a 3 night stay and the hotel had managed to get our rooms right beside each other. The rooms were spacious, bright and very clean. Housekeeping changed the bed linen immediately when they realised we needed twin beds instead of doubles. Considering we were on a very busy street we heard no noise in our rooms at night and had a good night's sleep in very comfortable beds. We loved the airy, spacious drawing room which created a feeling of calm. Breakfast was very good -would recommend getting up early to get a table where the buffet was laid out otherwise there was a bit of a walk to get all your breakfast requirements and bring them back to your table. The hotel was a superb location for Rome's major sites. We were able to walk to the Colesseum, Victor Emmanuelle monument, The Trevi Fountain , Spanish steps,Pantheon etc. Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great "Classic" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Italo_american_11
Reviews.Content: If style and service from yesteryear is what you're looking for, this hotel is the ticket at a reasonable price. While a bit "worn and tired" in some respects, classic decor and attire make the experience. Good breakfast on the quiet courtyard veranda. Even though the area around the Termine station is far from my favorite, it is convenient and I would definitely take my family to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: elie_flatter
Reviews.Content: Very nice old style palace in a very central location, perfect for business travelers or tourists alike - Breakfeast could be more elaborated, but this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine B
Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodations in a centralized location. The location was within walking distance to most popular sites and transporation. The large rooms and comfortable beds made our stay very pleasant. The desk personnel were very friendly/helpful and the breadfast buffet was great! We had beautiful weather and were able to enjoy the beautiful gardens. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and good position.”
Reviews.Author: john K
Reviews.Content: We walked a lot and needed our sleep! Great beds and rooms with lovely public rooms downstairs. The Quirinale is in a good position for old Rome, fountains etc. Bus outside to get to the Vatican. No.64 I think. Easy walk to Termini for airport connection. We took Terravision bus which was best value and efficient. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the smell!”
Reviews.Author: Travelors
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quirinale for 3 nights. The lobby and first floor are very nice, but as soon as we went to our room -- UGH, the smell! Horrible, musty smell that permeated everything, the clothes in my suitcase smelled of this even after we left. If you are sensitive to smells, this is not the place for you! The room had hardwood floors with a faded, worn area rug that looked a hundred years old. Our sheets had what looked like a speck of blood that did not come out when laundered -- we demanded new sheets be put on. The maid was gone for the night, so the porter left the sheet on our bed for us to change. Our beds had what appeared to be old, soft, creaky mattresses. When we complained, they gave us a board for the bed, which made it worse, leaving us with sore backs the next day. To their credit, on the third night they upgraded our room -- the mattress was slightly better, smell not quite so bad, but still annoying, and we would have loved to leave but had no choice. The breakfast buffet was great and restaurant area were very, very nice, but I would definitely not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, convenient location and old school charm”
Reviews.Author: Garth_Algar
Reviews.Content: Right at the top of Via Nazionale near the Piazza Repubblica, this hotel is perfectly placed for arriving in/ departing from Rome (Termini staion), as well as all the sights in the city centre and walking distance from the great little restaurants and bars in Monti. It is right bang on the busy street with all the traffic and pedestrians bustling past, but once you're inside it is like a huge marble oasis. It is all quite old fashioned, but the room was great, the bed incredibly comfortable and the buffet breakfast excellent. It's not over-decorated or styled just all very tasteful and clean, if slightly faded. In a city where it can cost a fortune to stay, it is also very good value (although obviously not cheap). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Will pass on Hotel Quirinale next time”
Reviews.Author: s3rndpt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to Italy for our 10th anniversary, where we stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel Quirinale in Rome. We will not return. We booked it partly on reviews from here, and we very disappointed. The bad: our room was small, which was fine, but it was very shabby and included a king bed that was hard as a rock with two small, flat pillows. On 3 separate occasions, we requested more pillows. The first, time, we were brought 1 pillow when we requested 3. The second time, we were completely ignored. The 3rd time, housekeeping brought us 2 new toiletry kits instead, and I had to explain what I wanted again- and she only brought 1 of the requested 2 pillows. We gave up at that point. Very frustrating. The bathroom was very dated, and had several issues. The bidet did not work at all. The shower had no pressure whatsoever, and the heat settings were such that it was either extremely hot or extremely cold- there was no in-between. It took literally 5 minutes to get hot water every time the shower was turned on. We had a balcony- that we could not use and had a terrible view of nothing except an open interior space looking into what appeared to be the laundry. One reason we had chosen Hotel Quirinale was because it said it had laundry services. And yes, it does- if you don't mind paying 4 euros to get a pair of socks washed, or 8 euros for a pair of pants. No thanks. The staff was not overly helpful. If you asked a question, they would answer, but did not have any additional suggestions, and often looked as though we were wasting their time. We did not feel like valued guests at all. The good: Breakfast was very nice, and plentiful. The eggs with the arrabiata sauce were lovely, in fact. The location was absolutely perfect. We could walk to the metro, the train station, the Vatican, Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum, the Forum. At first we thought we were perhaps being too picky, but when we left Rome, we went to Pompei and stayed in the lovely 3-star Hotel Diana for 4 nights. The experience was night and day. The staff was wonderful, helpful, and friendly. When we asked for more pillows, they brought them too us within 5 minutes. The bathroom had fantastic water pressure, the bidet worked, the bed was comfortable. The difference between Hotel Diana and Hotel Quirinale was amazing. Next time we visit Rome, we will check into staying at the Exedra, a block up, even though it is a good deal more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “My Dream Trip to Italy on 9//26/2011”
Reviews.Author: AngelaR
Reviews.Content: One of the hotels I stayed in was the Hotel Quirinale in Rome, Italy. It was an amazement to stay in such a hotel that took me back Centuries of the old country. The furniture, window treatments, Bathroom, Central Air, everything you wouldn't expect was included. Buffet breakfasts and as I was with the Chartwell Travel tours, we had excellent 5 course dinners also. The hotel was very accommodating. Location, Location, Location five stars. I would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Quirinale calmed our nerves”
Reviews.Author: sastoneesq
Reviews.Content: In October of 2011, my sister and I (middle aged women traveling alone) stayed in the Quirinale Hotel. The hotel is in a great location, close to the Termini, Metro access and fabulous shopping - not to mention walking distance to major attractions. Our room (527) was large, clean and overlooked the garden and dome of Opera house. Hotel staff were pleasant and spoke English gratiously. I have to give a shout-out to the bell man, who upon our early arrival understood the significance of the art glass we took for friends and handled it, and us, with kid gloves. Will surely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marilynr_brown
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here, as well as a friend on another floor. We were here from 22/9 to 30/9/11, and loved the rooms, the bed, the maid services, the free breakfasts that has something for everyone's choice and could be taken inside or out at the beautiful garden setting. The area was great and we could reach many attractions (Churches, Restaurants, etc.,) on foot or the concieierge was always there to hail us a taxi. The Free Internet service was great also for checking up on things at home while we were away. A big bouquet to all the employees at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: JemScott
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a cruise and really apprecited the great location and exactly what we expected....the only thing they could do is buy some matresses they arent made of slate. Met by helpfull porter and all luggage promptly sen tup to our rooms which were really good sizes and well appointed. The cot arrived promptly when asked and staff were all very friendly. The breakfast room is superb and the selection excellent with attentive service. Really worth the recommendation and woudl have no hesitation stayign here again..made the msitake to stay at Grand Hotel Plaza, a supposed 5 star, after the cruise and regretted it,,,

Reviews.Title: “A classic beauty”
Reviews.Author: Carlos668813
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, at the suggestion of our travel agent, stayed in the Quirinale in August. Some have called the hotel dated. To us it was much more a classic. There is a lovely European formality to the desk staff, the housekeepers, and the waiters. We arrived after an overnight flight, but much earlier than we had expected. The front desk accommodated us with a room right away rather than asking us to wait till check-in time, as they had every right to do. And, yes, breakfast was available. Breakfast at the Quirinale is a good thing. A full buffet with plates you can carry out to tables overlooking the garden, which as a green oasis in the heart of Rome. Our room was small, but overlooking the garden rather than the noisier street. The location is great for touring, close enough to the central Rome attractions that a retreat for a cool drink or nap is possible mid-day. It's on our list for a return to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: AMANDA P
Reviews.Content: A thoroughly enjoyable stay 16-23rd August, 7 nights in a standard room, which was more than adequate, very clean, and the staff were always friendly, breakfast was fantastic, excellent choice, and the lunch was the same. Will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast, no wi-fi in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Juliana B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last week. The hotel is very old, the carpets need to be changed urgently! The room was very good, huge, located in a "new" part of the hotel, view to the garden. I didn't like the fact that there was a door to the neighbour room, and we listened all the movements from people there. It was very very far from the lift! There was wi-fi only in the lobby, and it wasn't working in the first and second days. The breakfast was excellent, in a beautiful garden. The staff was nice, except for a very rude man in the reception. It's well located, but it could be better. I wouldn't stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Ok but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: 1971jc
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is old and is very 'Roman' it could do with some modernisation. It is fairly basic in all honesty. Breakfasts very good though and garden to rear where breakfast is served is lovely. The best bit about the hotel is the location - right on the Via Nazionale. Very handy for Fonata di Trevi, Italian Parliament etc. General area felt very safe at night. Idef would avoid anywhere around the metro station as the area certainly has a different feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and style but only the building & rooms”
Reviews.Author: mark62Belgium
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to be upgraded for one night from their sister hotel. It's a grand and luxurious place but the staff members are arrogant and unhelpful. Maybe because we came from their other hotel they didn't seem at all bothered. I forgot a pair a shoes after having moved back our original hotel but when I went back later the man at the desk didn't seem to believe me and "looked" on his PC concluding that nothing was found. My husband once forgot a suit in a hotel in England, well they sent it to us free of charge but here they didn't even bother to go and have a look or ask someone. Our hotel Diocleziano was more basic and somewhat noisy but the people were really nice and seemed embarrassed about the behaviour of their colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Danny G
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Quirinale 4 times. It's a 10-15 minute walk from Termini central station and is located at the beginning on via Nazionale. It's an old style hotel - most rooms are spacious, very well equipped (TV with various channels in many langiages, a minibar, a good bathroom / shower, etc). The breakfast buffet can get quite crowded in the morning, but the selections is very good indeed. Not cheap at all, but worth the price. Remember than when you come to Rome now, an additional fee of 3 Euro per night (per person!) has to be paid at the hotel upon check out. Rome is quite unbearable lately. It has always been crowded, but lately it has simply become difficult to move around. During peak hours, don't even think about boarding a public bus, unless your idea of fun is travelling like sardines. Popular places are very, very noisy - much more (!!!) than, say, 2-3 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Old charm (and some rough edges) in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Mucciville
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steeped in old charm (visible straight off as you notice that it seems the whole place is staffed by elder males). Obviously, in some aspects this is a plus, such as the size of the rooms (huge by 2011 standards) and the high ceilings, in other places it leads to a shoddy effect, such as the carpets which have definitely seen better days. The bathroom was also incredibly large, with excellent water pressure, and the usual toiletries provided (bring your own conditioner, the norm in Italy). A corridor led to the bedroom and a walk-in closet could be found off the corridor, though there was no wardrobe or chest of drawers in the room itself. The bed was pretty comfortable and a flat screen TV was provided with a generous choice of channels for free. Being shortsighted, the mirrors provided were inadequate for me as they were behind a very large sink or vanity making it impossible for me to get close enough to do my make-up :) It's well located on one of Rome's main thoroughfares (Via Nazionale), just around the corner from the main train station, Termini, though the area around the hotel itself is very safe and you wouldn't even realise the train station is close by. It's also a short bus or taxi ride away from the centro storico. In truth, you can also walk to many key locations such as the Colosseum and the Vittoriano and Piazza Venezia, which then leads on to the Pantheon. The onsite restaurant is excellent, 5 star standard food, service with a smile, and prices are very decent. We got a super rate (but this was probably because we were there for a family wedding and booked several rooms) so I don't know if I'd stay here if I had to pay a much higher rate. I'd probably prefer to be slightly more central. Also one thing that was a bit inconvenient was that breakfast was strictly till 10 a.m. even on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Old world ambiance, and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Fourmuskateers
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Rome in May of 2011, and booked this hotel with Expedia. We found the reviews to be a little confusing, as some people said the staff was rude and others said the hotel was not great. Well here is our opinion of this hotel. Rooms The room we had consisted of twin beds. The beds were comfortable, and the room itself was great. Our view was not wonderful as it looked over the roof at the back of the building, however this was not important to us as we were always gone during the day, and generally not returning until later in the evening. I would rather be at the back as the sirens were non stop on the street. Our shower did not work, but the hose did so we just sat in the tub to shower...no big deal. Draperies and ambiance wonderful. Lobby Checking in was wonderful, the staff was very helpful, as well as the doorman. The area where you could relax, just past the lobby was full of old world decor. My daughter and I would come back mid afternoon and have a cafe americano, and we would be served a plate of cookies as well. When we had a drink in the evening we were given chips and peanuts. What a great service, and the prices were reasonable. Breakfast We had breakfast every morning in the garden. There was a lot of selection and the coffee was superb. The view of the garden was spectacular and we loved this part of our trip. Location The location of this hotel was perfect for our city excursions. We did a lot of walking which we enjoyed. The hotel is only 20 mins walking to the Trevi fountain, 10 mins to the Colloseum and around the corner from the metro. I would highly recommend this hotel. This was our first visit to Rome, and I would return to this hotel without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great location we have returned to this hotel and spent 5 days there. We will return on our next trip to rome”
Reviews.Author: Sharonite
Reviews.Content: There is a bus stop across the street that wil take you straight to St. Peters and the rail station is close by too.

Reviews.Title: “Few gripes but overall a good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pancaketuesday
Reviews.Content: I got this Hotel cheap enough, Internet special 100/night, however upon arriving our Hotel Room was easily the worst Hotel Room I have ever stayed in for a 4 star. It was tiny with no furniture. A quick complaint and we we changed room. From there on I have no complaints, bar the white lie about an Iron from reception, none available because of fire safety, yeah right. At this price and breakfast included the Quirinale is just fine and good value for money! Wouldn't like to pay more though...

Reviews.Title: “All i Have to say is WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: rrajs
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. I stayed here when I visited rome with my family in 90s...and i still have good memories and pics of it...i hope it has stayed the same.. very good food..excellent service!! If I am not mistaken it's at the heart of rome..very good location!!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel located in the Centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jenjen15_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to this hotel for our 10th wedding anniversary having stayed here for our honeymoon. It did not let us down. We opted for the superior room this time( we had a suite for our honeymoon) and the room was more than adequate. The room had antique furniture, a very large and comfortable bed,large bathroom and very powerful aircon (had to change the power from High to Low despite temperatures outside around 37C). The food is outstanding - we had dinner in the hotel as well as the inclusive breakfast. The dinner was the best meal we had during our trip and was also very reasonable (hotel guests get 20% off the menu price). The main reception rooms are grand and the restaurant/garden area is very relaxing and calm despite being so central. There is internet access in the bedrooms which you need to pay for however there is a computer room beside reception where access is free and there is also free WiFi. The hotel is located only 5-10 mins walk from Termini train station (if you are travelling via Ryanair to Ciampino Airport, the Terravision or SIT bus will drop you off at the Termini station). There is also a Metro station (Republicca) located 2 mins walk from the hotel which is ideal if you are visiting the Vatican - approx 2.2 mile walk from the hotel. However all other sights are within walking distance - Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Il Vittranio, Spanish Steps and so on. A perfect hotel... location, service and quality all under one roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Walk to all the sites!”
Reviews.Author: NLrock
Reviews.Content: Pros - helpful and friendly staff. Air conditioning was a must and was lovely after a day in 40 degree heat! Great breakfast buffet served daily (included in price). Hotel was within walking distance to most major sites in Rome. Large rooms with plenty of space for everything. Cons - have to pay a lot for internet access (i think 20-24 euro a day). Beds were not very comfortable but after walking all day it didn't seem to matter much. A personal con was that the safes still use keys and not codes so when our bag (with our keys) was stolen we had to pay 150 euros to have the safe opened again!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: HappyflowerKent_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights after travelling from Venice (Hotel Bonvecchiati). Hotel is very close to the main train station and very easy to find. The hotel itself is a very grand and impressive building on the inside. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable, we had two rooms, one on the second floor, the other on the fourth. All of the staff were very helpfull even though our Italian is not the best. We had the good fortune to have lunch provided and the food could not be faulted. As with the hotel in Venice, we would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to relatives and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Some great points and some things lacking”
Reviews.Author: WinwinDover_Delaware
Reviews.Content: Walking into this hotel we were very taken with the size and beauty of the lobby. The staff was very helpful. Unfortunately, the rooms were desperately in need of refurbishing. The furniture, carpeting, and bathrooms were old and not up to the cleanliness or beauty of the lobby. On the positive side, the hotel provided a sumptuous, extensive breakfast in a beautiful garden area. Having stayed in a different hotel in Rome last year, overall we were disappointed. If they fixed the rooms, this hotel has the potential of being fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cynak
Reviews.Content: It is convenient to the train station and pretty centrally located but NOT "steps from the Spanish Stairs" as advertised. Check the map, it is at least several blocks away. The hotel and lobby are nice, the rooms small as expected in Italy I think.

Reviews.Title: “No iron, seriously !”
Reviews.Author: HarrogateGb
Reviews.Content: Pros Location good/excellent, near the termini so you dont have to "cart" your luggage all over Rome. Room was clean and looked very nice indeed Air conditioning worked Room had mini-bar (most welcome at 4am when you are thirsty) Breakfast good standard (and they have decent tea, other foreign hotels take note) Bar/courtyard stunning Room rate was very reasonable still it was August (and very hot) Cons We were there for a wedding, but due to regulations there is no iron in the hotel at all ! you have to send out for it be washed and ironed at a cost of 5 euros ! Funny though other guests staying at a hotel nearby didnt have the same regulations (you figure !) there is a safe in the room (FOC) but you have to ask for the key they dont give you it automatically when you check in ! shower was more than a little unpredicatable on whether it was going to be hot or cold ! the drinks in the bar are wallet busting 25 euros for a large jack daniels and coke (I have had the same drink in the mandarin in London and it was £14 and I thought that was stupid !) there is a tax of 3 euros a night that they dont tell you about. The 6 euro cost isnt going to break the bank the issue I just like to know in advance that I am not been "squeezed". No free wi-fi If I was staying in Rome again, I wouldnt book here, I would try somewhere else that's not to say the hotel is rubbish, it isnt, I just think things like the safe key (which really annoyed my wife) and the rip off drinks price left us wishing to try somewhere different

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with traditional and historical flair”
Reviews.Author: Woman50
Reviews.Content: I participated an international meeting hold in this hotel, and spent 3 nights there. The hotel was a positive surprise: Good location nearby the Opera, with walking distance to historical sites and Termini station. Spacious building with nice interior and great atmosphere. Charming and relaxing garden, perfect for a drink or ice-cream. Spacious room (double) with even more spacious bathroom. Good and various breakfast. Very helpful staff. Wifi was free of charge on the ground floor in the common area. A login code was available at the desk on request. Besides the reception, there are 2 PC for free use of internet. I liked the hotel and its atmosphere! The price may be a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for a Rome holiday”
Reviews.Author: Mr_KR
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Quirinale Hotel and were quite pleased with our stay. This was our first time to Rome and we were not sure where was the best location to pack in a multitude of things to do in Rome, but in the end this hotel served us well. It was a pleasant 15 minute walk to The Colosseum area, 10 minutes to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps, and a 7 Euro cab ride to the Vatican area. Most conventiently, it is around the corner from the main train terminal, allowing good access to regional trains or to the Airport train. As for the hotel itself, the rooms are clean and comfortable, albeit an aged decor fitting with the older style of the building. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was a reasonable standard. There is a very pleasant coutyard to sit and eat breakfast. Service levels were OK, but nothing out of the ordinary and somewhat reflecting a less intimate 'big hotel' feeling. If you arrive early, don't expect to get your room early. They appear intent on not allowing check-in before 1400. Although we had a room that faced the courtyard and was nice and quiet, I am not so sure what the noise levels would be like for rooms that face the very busy Via Nazionale road. Overall, we'd be happy to stay again at the Quirinale Hotel. Finally, watch out for the very dodgy Rome taxi rides from the Airport. We were stung by a driver using an incorrect meter rate!

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm can't be beaten”
Reviews.Author: prclements
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you would expect for an its outward charm and grace. It is beautifully decorated with many artworks and exudes old world charm. tHe staff were impeccable in their attention to patrons and made our stay a very pleasant one with the hotel being a welcome haven from the huge summer crowds in Rome. The very pleasant leafy courtyard where a bar and al fresco dining could be had, or just a gelato, was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozz59
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were very clean. nice size for Europe. We were three couples, however, we all had different size rooms, yet paid same amount. Breakfast was delicious. Try to sit outside in the garden area. It was convenient to everything. Walked to Spanish steps, Tevi fountain. Staff recommended excellent restaurants in walking distance and reasonable. Investigate tours and hop on bus on your own.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: hollysmum80
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for our 25th anniversary we were very pleased with our room which was over looking the garden and big .The staff where freindly .Hotel was very central for most of the attractions 10- 15 mins walk. food was nice, we had lunch and bottle of wine included in price when we booked hotel. would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yetti22
Reviews.Content: Out of the four hotels I stayed in while touring Italy, this was absolutely the best one! The Quirinale Hotel had very big rooms compared to all the other hotels that we stayed in. Their rooms were clean and were presented very nicely. The best thing about the rooms at the Quirinale Hotel was the giant bathtubs within every room. Their bathtubs were enormous and it made it very easy for myself (a 6'2 male) to take a bath. Every other hotel I stayed at didn't have big enough tubs for me to take a relaxing bath after a long day. The staff at the hotel was very helpful with every thing that we needed. They were on top of things and were ready to help us whenever we needed. The INCLUDED breakfast with your stay there was very good. It was always on time and had a nice assortment of food and drinks that everyone could enjoy. It was very safe to walk around the streets near our hotel at nighttime. . This Hotel is placed in the center of Rome and is within a 10 minute walking distance to The Colosseum, The Pantheon, The Trevi Fountain, Palatine Hill, and most especially The Train Station! It was very easy to locate and had nice restaurants all around it.! I would recommend this hotel to anyone that would like to have a comfy/big room while visiting Rome. :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel but front staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: Jessie222
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe. Our first stop was in Rome and we stayed at the Quirinale Hotel. The location is great! We found the hotel lobby to be elegant and enjoyed the beauty of our room. The only disappointing factor was the front desk staff. They were not friendly and made it seem as though we were doing them a favor by being there. They were not customer service friendly at all. We traveled through Europe, Greece and Turkey for several weeks and this staff was by far the least friendly. The breakfast was exceptionally good and our room was well cleaned daily.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property with no negatives!”
Reviews.Author: HBDoug
Reviews.Content: Professional, although not overly friendly, staff was very receptive to our needs and helpful. We arrived early and the bellman locked up our luggage in a secure storeroom. Room was spacious, clean, well equipped, and had super A/C - a must since we were there at the hottest point of the year (36 degrees and humid). Breakfast was the best of the many we stayed at during our two weeks in Italy. Super attentive breakfast staff and spotlessly clean. The garden is very nice and well kept. Overall great value, nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catsy19
Reviews.Content: When searching for a hotel in Rome that would accommodate our family of four in one room, I found the Hotel Quirinale. Although we only stayed one night, I was happy that this hotel was beautifully, old world elegant and spotlessly clean. The staff that we did interact with were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a great start to our day with many choices. In the evening, we took the 15 minute walk to the Trevi fountain with the kids. I hope that I am lucky enough to stay at this hotel again someday!

Reviews.Title: “I'm American, and I would stay here”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlyer2011
Reviews.Content: It was only a one-day layover for me on a business trip through Europe, so I wasn't being picky. The room was small and the bathroom facility was kind of old, but I guess it adds to the charm of the hotel. Front desk staff was professional, and the bellhop was very nice and kind. It's a short walk to Roma Termini, the train station, as well as the subway / underground. It's right in the middle of a shopping district, which was convenient. I did not try the restaurants in the hotel because I was immediately out of the door with my map and camera. Overall, considering the good price (comparatively) I paid for for the room, it was not a bad choice for a short stay. I would come back to the Quirinale. Cheers,

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Americans do not stay here! Hotel staff are not helpful, rooms bad, food bad and we have never written a review bef”
Reviews.Author: davischri
Reviews.Content: The staff does not try to help you. I tried to mail a package back to us and they told me i had to figure it out myself in basic words. Day of check in we arrived early and the front desk recommended lunch in the garden - food terrible chicken worse than fast food - tried to return it and they told me i had to pay for it. I went to the front desk and had to complain before they would give me another dish. Mold all in bathrooms, small showers, water runs into floor b/c curtains are hard to close and dont cover tub, toilet did not work, had to turn on sink to somehow flush the toilet (my wife happened to be using the sink while i heard gurggling noises coming from the toilet). Overall don't book a room with this hotel group. We travel a lot and this was our first experience with this group in Europe. We live in atlanta, georgia and will never use this group no matter where and how nice the website says. I told front desk about our complaints and they just pushed us off.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: opihiman
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our time in Rome, and this hotel was key to our experience. Old but not stuffy, elegant but not pretentious. Wonderful and helpful staff, delicious breakfast, and great location near the Repubbica Metro stop. 15 minute walk to Victor Emanuel-monument, 20 to Spanish Steps. Very clean. Cool old elevator in the back of the hotel (two modern ones up front). We were booked to this hotel through a Gate1 Travel. It had good reviews on this site, but I think it should be rated higher. Only fault was wired internet in rooms. Ask the front desk for access code. We did not have to pay. One other person found an wireless access point. Top Secret tip: ask for hot chocolate at the morning breakfast buffet. You can thank me later. If I get back to Rome I will certainly stay there again. Contact me for questions: djwilliams at mac dot com

Reviews.Title: “OMG - this is a great place”
Reviews.Author: 60Chicks
Reviews.Content: The lobby is so pretty - the staff very nice - breakfast was lovely - and there was a garden where we ate every morning. Great location - close to Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. Rooms were clean and lots of room to roam in - will be back for sure and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Roma”
Reviews.Author: lil_lisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Roma and spent the entire week at the Quirinale. Aside from the comfortable and clean rooms (we had a standard which exceeded my expectations), the breakfast and common rooms were very welcoming. The breakfast served in the garden was more than sufficient to kick start our morning. The biggest selling point of this hotel was its location. The bus stop and metro which serves almost every area you would need to see in Roma is steps outside the hotel front door. The train terminal is an easy 5-8 minute walk from the hotel. There is a grocery store close to the hotel which allowed us to pick up snacks, water and other adult beverages. Due to the central location we could come back to our rooms mid day to cool off and get hydrated. I would recommend this hotel and will return.

Reviews.Title: “romantic week in rome”
Reviews.Author: joan-i-carme
Reviews.Content: room: nice and clean beds: large and confortable location and communications: excellent breakfast: great: something else: we highly recomend the garden; have a last drink there while summarizing the experiences of the day

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: bhorit
Reviews.Content: very beutifull, looks like a palace, rooms are nice, clean & comfortable. staff is friendly & very helpfull, breakfast is served in the garden - very plesent. best location - near republica, bus & metro.

Reviews.Title: “The Garden Makes It!”
Reviews.Author: erchurch
Reviews.Content: The hotel has obviously seen better days, but the faded glory sort of adds to the experience. The garden was my favorite. After a busy day of sightseeing, we loved sitting out there for a peaceful rest with a cold drink. One night we could even hear a male opera star rehearsing in the adjacent opera house! Magic! Having booked a room for three, we got a very large room on the top floor, on the front of the building. The street noise was muted, but there. The real noise came from guests in the adjoining room. The (locked) connecting door in the closet area was thin, and we could sometimes hear their conversation word for word! But the room was pretty and very clean. The free business center was great--and truly free. They even had a free printer. Service was good and breakfast was very nice. The location is convenient for sightseeing and very near the Termini, so transportation was easy. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Soliterri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally located and Beautiful! Room was big, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Classic with charm.”
Reviews.Author: Alstromeria33
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Quirinale turned my business trip into a vacation. I consciously picked up this hotel because of the garden, and asked for a room overlooking it. I knew I wanted to avoid street side in Roma. And was I right! My room was actually a corner room and just the side street was very noisy. Fortunately the windows are double pane, with outside and inside wood-shutters and heavy curtains (yet barely enough). Inside it was very quite. (ask for a room towards the inside of the block. I was lucky to be upgraded to a suite (324), corner room with a sitting area and a VERY large bed room. The style is Classic, the furniture sometimes feels more old than Classic. Yet not too badly so. The bedding was ok, did not strike me as either bad or excellent. The bathroom large and clean with a large window. Bathrobes and slippers. Amenities : could be improved. Flat TV (41"). but no guide... good luck. I regretted no water-heater and iron in the room, but apparently a policy to avoid fire. In general the room was very clean and the service was good, most of the time amiable. I really enjoyed breakfast in the veranda by the garden or in the garden. The buffet was really nice (I indulged on fresh fruit salad and great coffee everyday, of course there is much more - Italy is not so strong on pastries and breads though) One night the garden hosted a costume party - that I saw from the window. Renaissance style... in case you would be interested ask about this. The lounges are very roomy (extra high ceilings), a bar is opened inside and outside in the garden (all day ?). The garden is a bit smaller than ou would think from the web site. But very nicely planted. with a charming foutain (could have done a better job with the decoration of the outside restaurant area) And the hotel is very well located for visiting most of central Roma by foot. I did not try the hotel's restaurnat but found Tratorie nearby each time I needed (Mc Dnonals across the street in case of craving or home-sickeness emergency ;-) Surely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: courtmac62
Reviews.Content: Wonderful 4 day stay at the Quirinale. Staff excellent, food superb, location fantastic. Walked to all the main sights, and used metro ( 200 metres away) to get to Vatican City. We loved the food here along with the other restaurants near by. Will go back to finish our "tour" of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy but still very good”
Reviews.Author: Langworthy
Reviews.Content: I would like to say how much we enjoyed our stay at your hotel. It was very busy and the staff were charming, particularly the Maitre 'D' in the restaurant were nothing was too much trouble. I can understand now why so many of the managers of the great hotels in London are Italian. I was fearful when I saw how busy the hotel was that both service and quality may be poor (we had a bad experience in Florence a few years ago) but we need not have worried. The only small problem was that you may need more staff on reception during busy periods

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MagellanMilan
Reviews.Content: Maybe other rooms have better noise protection or simply are not on Via Nazionale. My room was very noisy until very late when the traffic calmed down. The mattress was uneven, the internet connection too slow. Breakfast is just average, although in a nice garden The building and interiors are old but nice, the hotel could be of another, higher category with a better management.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel but........once is enough”
Reviews.Author: Dlmink65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quirinale May 25th-31st. We were in Rome for a family wedding and a little sight-seeing. Yes, the hotel is in a good location. Yes, it has the old world charm whatever that means. For me that is about the only good thing about the hotel. The beds were horrible. My sister reported the same miserable mattress problem in her room. We didn't complain because my sister-in-law had booked the rooms and she loves the hotel. The room I shared with my husband was very small. We had two what I would describe as dining room chairs which were rickety at best. There was no closet only an armoire. For the same money my sister, who was by herself, had a much larger room.(comfy chair, closet.etc) There is absolutely no way to tell what you will get in the way of a room. We did get a garden view but I would have preferred a little more space. I just read reviews written by other guests years ago. In 2008 another couple stayed at the hotel in room 426. The latch on the shutter was broken and the bed was uncomfortable then.....Guess what It's three years later and that shutter latch is still broken and the bed ...harder than a rock. If I ever go back to Rome, and that is a big if, I will not stay at the Quirinale.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was filled with old world charm and elegance.”
Reviews.Author: ldud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Quirinale Roma for 3 nights. A breakfast buffet was included in the room price, and we ate in a tranquil garden setting. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly, and the location made it easy to walk to most sightseeing spots and many restaurants and shops. There was a small fitness room on the 1st floor. The hotel was also close to public transportation and a taxi stand if needed. Maps of Rome were available at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & helpful staff, convenient location - nice bar, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Sharonjarn
Reviews.Content: The room was large, lots of closet room, safe provided, very large marble bathroom. Breakfast was great, very nice to sit on the terrace overlooking the hotel's interior garden space for breakfast. Free wi-fi. Staff helpful, polite - gave us a good restaurant recommendation and advice on local custom. Very short walk to Metro stop (Republica) and close to Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel let down by bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: Patsy060
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, lovely hotel, friendly staff and great breakfast but the standard bedrooms were like cells. Although clean, comfortable and adequately equiped they were so small two people couldn't pass at the end or side of bed. There was no natural light due to extremely heavy curtains which you couldn't pull back, this was probably due to the fact that they overlooked a very unsightly area at the back of the hotel, it was very difficult to see the sky or determine the weather. The shower didn't work in our first room so we had to move, unfortunately the shower didn't work in the next room, we refused to move again and they replaced the showerhead and it was fine. The location is great and as lonfg as you don't get a cell room this is good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Busy area”
Reviews.Author: MarjorieCampbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. Our lucky friends got a Junior Suite upgrade. When asked reception staff for a change of room (one where we could sit down in some chairs) they obliged the next day. Hotel good for metro and cafe' type restaurants but next time we would look for quieter area with some of the lovely piazzas within walking distance at night, as after a day of walking around we wanted to go to the nearest quaint eating place. This hotel is on a busy road with plenty of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: BILLDC
Reviews.Content: Great location. Only a 10 minute walk from RR station and 5 minutes to the Republic Metro station. Easy walking distance to many sites. Excellent staff. Very good breakfast. Comfortable bed in large room. This is the second time we stayed there and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: bebabuco
Reviews.Content: Well located by Piazza de Republica, around the corner from Opera House this is one of the oldest and most charming hotels in Rome.Rooms are beautifully decorated with classic furniture and high ceiling, Restaurant overlooks the open garden There is a gym, Staff at the reception desk is one of the best! The lounge decor is fabulous and there is a nice bar, concierge service is really good too. If you want a nice hotel in Rome fairly priced this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Across the world this is one of the worst hotels to reside in.”
Reviews.Author: ximiei
Reviews.Content: Management appears to have been laid off. With a guaranteed reservation, you are not assured a room nor assistance in locating suitable accommodations elsewhere in Rome. Avoid the Hotel Quirinale.

Reviews.Title: “The Quirinale was the perfect setting for our 40th wedding anniversaryThis hotel exceeded our expectations.”
