Reviews.Author: chanelno5Clonmel
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The friendly and helpful staff from the porters to the restaraunt staff made us feel welcome. Our room was beautiful and everything extremely clean and the complimentary bottle of champagne for our anniversary was a bonus. On the practical side it was well situated with an easy walk to the metro and bus station and sites to explore like the Trevi fountain were easily walkable. Peaceful, pleasant but with a gentle grandeur this is a hotel I would recommend highly. Sorry can't give a true estimate of price as our children treated us for a present.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: petergud
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for three nights, the hotel it self is great, but we had bad luck with the bed. It was like laying on the floor. Ask for a soft bed, the couple we went with, had better bed then we got.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel with excellent food and service”
Reviews.Author: highnoon1953
Reviews.Content: Impressive reception and lounge decor Excellent range and quality of breakfast options Very good bar, reception and concierge service

Reviews.Title: “A well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: purplepea_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is perfect. We walked everywhere from this central location but located directly outside is a bus stop and a Metro station. My one main tip is for if you're visiting the Vatican. Thw buses are jammed, there's no way we would've got on one. Howvever, the metro is the same price, just next to the bus stop and only a 15 minute journey. Much much much easier to use than the buses...and no pick pockets!

Reviews.Title: “interesting older style hotel-”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler036
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel in november 2010 for a short business meeting- the hotel is perfect in terms of feeling on old style rome- the rooms were reflecting that- older style windows, bathroom, etc which felt very refreshing. i had very good service, the reception was very efficient, good breakfast. it was central, close to our meeting rooms, on a shopping street. so it was a good stay-

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladycates
Reviews.Content: i love the classic style room.. though it looks like haunted on the alley ways because of its antique kind of setting.. it shows superiority and wealth.. i am always excited going down for breakfast in the morning. food is great.. staffs are polite and helpful.. hotel is located in the city center where its accessible in buying drinks and some baby food outside the hotel.. some few shops outside for shopping. i would love to come back in rome and stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful older style hotel”
Reviews.Author: offlinespace
Reviews.Content: This hotel has high ceilings, very beautiful rooms (and hallways!) and central location. The staff are all helpful and everything is on par. The only thing is a little of a downer is that while the rooms are very beautiful, they feel a LITTLE like they haven't been updated since early 80's. The hotel is still great, it's just missing a little bit of the modern touch. And unfortunately this applies to doors to the room too so a little too much noise gets in. If you have ever been to San Francisco and stayed at Westin St. Francis -the old heritage part of that hotel you'll know what I mean. Things there look absolutely amazing in old-style, but have modern touches (like an updated bath, LCD TV, thicker doors) and that makes the total experience awesome. Here's there's just a little bit missing. I would still recommend it though.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL NEW/OLD HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: adman_10
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. here is my summary in point form: - good included breakfast - friendly hotel staff who tried to do everything possible to make us happy. - close to the Termini - a walk to any attraction in Rome. - beautiful room. - beautiful lobby and environment. - extremely rich in culture, just like the city. - close to plenty of great restaurants. 100% recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: californianative0055
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Quirinale was a great way to start off our trip to Italy. From the outside you would never imagine how big it is and it is absolutely beautiful. The staff was outstanding from the minute we arrived. Our travel agent had booked the hotel for my friend and I. At the last minute my daughter decided to come from Florence and join us. They quickly changed us to a larger room at a very reasonable upcharge. The room was spacious and very clean. The bathroom was huge and had a tub/shower which was nice. Even though we looked out over the main street, the windows were double-paned and the room was very quiet. The breakfast buffet was unbelievable. The first morning we were there was a Sunday so we thought that must be why it was so extravagant. But no, it was that great every day...fresh fruit, fresh pastries, 2 kinds of eggs, bacon, cold meats, cheeses, salad bar, cereals, yogert, dessert bar, juices, coffee, etc. Amazing! Davide at the front desk also arranged for a driver to take us on a private tour. This was a real treat. He took us to various points of interest, explained a little history, then waited as we spent as much time as we wanted in each place. This was a great way to get a whirlwind overview of the city if you don't have too many days there. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and service.”
Reviews.Author: Simes007
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a popular location, friendly staff make for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyParrot2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Quirinale for 7 days 10/31/10 - 11/6/10. The hotel was very pleasant, elegant, but a little worn. The room was spacious and the bathroom large and clean. The housekeeping staff did a great job. However, our room was extremely warm and the staff was unable to correct it. In addition, our phone was broken and although they promised to send a technician it was never done. The buffet breakfast was excellent. The hotel is centrally located near the train station and subway. Cabs are readily available in front of the hotel. The hotel is on a great street for shopping. Do not pay the high prices for snacks, soda, etc go to the grocery store about 3 blocks down Via Nazionale on the opposite side of the street. Meals at a very reasonable cost can be had at El Barocco Restaurant and Pizzeria on Via Napoli, a cross street located 2 blocks down across the street from the hotel. Inexpensive internet access can be found at the Internet Point located on Via Napoli, a cross street located 2 blocks down across the street from the hotel (turn left at the Irish Pub). The Irish Pub was also great for a meal and coffee. Over all the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Feedback_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first weekend in Novemvber 2010. Our room was smaller than the ones features in the pictures with two single beds but it was fine for us. The hotel has loads of period charm and character without being tired. The place was clean and the staff were helpful, location was good. I would happily stay here again and recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “Roman touch.”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonkiesDT
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to the main train station and its also within walking distance to all the attractions.Its not much to look at from the outside but once inside you are pleasantly suprised.We were allocated a room at the front of the hotel but considering we were ther for 5 nights we asked to be moved to the rear of the hotel which wasnt a problem.The rooms are quite big actually,a little dated but it only adds to the charm of the place.The rooms at the rear overlook the gardens and are a lot quieter.Everyone knows the main attractions in Rome but I would advise anyone who likes to get away from the commercialism for an afternoon to visit the Villa Borghese.Its a 148 acre park just north of the Spanish steps and its a wonderful oasis for some peace and quiet.Back to the hotel and we only dined here on our final evening,much to our dissappointment - the food here was superb - we were both blown away.We ate outside in the intimate gardens of the hotel,you'd never think you were in a city hotel.It was a great way to end a fabulous stay here.Also regards to the Maitre'd Daniel who lived for some time in my hometown of Cork Ireland,thank you for a wonderful meal and a great stay overall.Arrivederci!

Reviews.Title: “Rome is WOW, WOW, WOW - MAGICAL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kolace
Reviews.Content: HOTEL My husband and I took a mediterranean cruise this past June and prior to cruising we visited Rome for a few days. We stayed at HOTEL QUIRINALE. It was very close to the Metro, walking distance. The staff was super friendly, concierge was great, our stay included breakfast which was terrfic!! - great value for your money bc breakfast in rome can run 23Euros so we saved some money there. However, the beds were VERY VERY UNCOMFORTABLE!!! Felt like you were sleeping on rocks, our backs were in pain every morning we woke up. We normally stay at Hyatts and Marriotts and were not too picky but we did not get an ounce of sleep. Room was very small but we didnt care bc we didnt spend much time in the room. We just wanted a well - air conditioned room with a comfortable bed. While the staff and food was great, i would not return bc the beds were uncomfortable and ac was down. 3 most important things to us were location, sleep and ac. CITY MAGICAL!! Magnificent! Beautiful! SOOOOO Romantic!! Grab some gelato and walk around the SPANISH STEPS at night and go visit the TREVI Fountain!! it is an AMAZING city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Historic atmosphere in historic city”
Reviews.Author: coe65
Reviews.Content: Hotel Quirinale has a perfect location if you want to stay near Termini station and all the major attractions in Rome. Easy access, because metro station Republicca is right on the corner and busstops in front of the hotel. We had the luck to stay in the rooms with balcony, (roomnrs 538-541) I think there are only a few of them. But if you get the chance take a room with the balcony. It is not a great view, but it is nice to relax a bit after a day of sightseeing! The room is clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a bit below expectation (after all it is a 4* hotel), orange juice and coffee from a machine, and every day the same. At an extra charge you can order extra things like fresh coffee or eggs, but the breakfast could do with a bit more phantasy. It is nice to have breakfast on the terrace outside however! Service is good and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel, Grand price for little value”
Reviews.Author: ZAExplorer
Reviews.Content: Definately not a four star hotel. Website will show you pictures of their BEST suite. The standard rooms definately do not look like this. The are very small, very old and not great. Bed was extremely hard and room was very average /poor overall (probably why they dont show them on the web). Internet TV does not work! It messed up our online check in. When we went to front desk for help, they were not prepared to assist us by using their computer, and merely told us to go to an internet cafe (which was closed) This clouded the friendliness of the other staff expereinces. We would say, if you want to pay 325 Euros a night for a "4" star, dont stay here, do your homework. We would rate this a 2 star, bordering on a 3. The breakfast was sufficient, but the rooms are nothing to write home about. See our traveller pics..

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel with olde world charm - much better than we anticipated !”
Reviews.Author: StephVince
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when entering the reception area at Quirinale - very grand and charming - reception staff also reflected this. Our rooms were quite large and the bathroom also was large. Dining room was delightful but the alfresco eating area (balcony and paved area) was outstanding with well maintained garden area - very romantic (even for two 55 year olds !!). The breakfast smorgasbord was a feast to behold - many varieties of meats hot and cold, cheeses, cereals, breads, cakes, yoghurts and my favourite fresh fruit salad. Serving staff were fantastic and even helped to carry food back to our table. The hotel is within walking distance to Fontana di Trevi, the Vatican and it's just a great location to go strolling around and we found some really good back street local restaurants with delicious authentic foods at very cheap prices.

Reviews.Title: “bellesimo”
Reviews.Author: carol186602
Reviews.Content: i travelled to this hotel 06sep 3 x nights with my mother, i am a travel agent in ireland and was hoping this hotel would live up to expectation's for her on arrival once we went in to reception she was in awe of the hotels beatiful antiques and extremely friendly (without being intrusive) this was nothing until she saw our room we has been upgraded to a superior room (302) was out of this world it really took her breath away (she is still talking about it) The hotel is located on Via Nazionale just down from the Repulica Fountain and 5mins walk to termini station the best is the garden at the hotel a little piece of heaven after the noise of the main street this is serene The only neg is the price of food and drink at the hotel we paid 24.00euro to two gin and tonics and the meal for dinner approx 80.00euro for two . That said Rome is very very expensive (I am from Dublin) but even so ouch If you are booking this hotel you will not be dissapointed Ciao Carol

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel, So-So Location, but Excellent A/C!!”
Reviews.Author: kitschy
Reviews.Content: This hotel okay is perfectly fine. Location is okay -- good if you're willing to take public transportation as it's very convenient to the subway. We're from NYC and I realized that we were within walking distance to a lot of places -- but a long distance, like 30-45 minutes, but on the subway, you could quickly and easily get to several tourist attractions and also to Termini the main station where you could connect to the other subway line. Nearest main attraction was the Colosseum -- we got lost so our estimation of distance isn't the best but it was easily a 20 minute walk or more despite the front desk saying it was ten minutes. No business center or place to print boarding passes which I thought was odd for such a large hotel, but there's a business center nearby. Staff could be more helpful. Excellent restaurant and beautiful courtyard. So-so breakfast but the location was great, overlooking the lovely courtyard. We had a room on the courtyard, which was a bit dicey because there was a wedding going on -- noise ended around midnight, but that could be a concern for folks in warmer months who like to turn in early. Also, there wasn't free Internet access, but you could purchase if you needed to. The air conditioning in this hotel was excellent -- and since we were in Rome when it was over 90, that is a big endorsement. I probably wouldn't stay here again -- unless it was in the summertime, because knowing that the A/C is solid is key for summer in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, antique style, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: ECAU
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel last week of August. We were travelling as part of a wedding group from ireland. The hotely is quite close to main attractions, in particular the Trevi Fountain and at the end of Via Nazional is the Museum of the Unknown Solider, magnificient building!! At the top of the street is the termini station so great location for access to transport. Althou like any city you will spend alot of time walking anyway. The hotel itself is antique style, big rooms, high ceilings and overall giving a 'grand' feeling.. We had an early flight so our rooms were not ready on arrival (we got there at approx 11am), we had to wait a couple of hours. The hotel has a lovely garden/ courtyard (this is where the wedding receptions are held!) which was lovely to sit out in. The rooms in the hotel definitely vary, we were in room 118 which is a double room and it was very clean, high ceilings, good air conditioning, big enough bathroom, beds werent great thou, not very lavish or comfy, basic style! However in comparison to some of the other rooms my family had, there were much better rooms on offer. Breakfast in the hotel was great, big offering of hot and cold food and lovely pastries, cakes, cereals, yoghurts etc. its served from 6am-10am. The only negative thing I must comment on was the price of drinks in the hotel- OMG shockingly expensive we thought. A can of fanta/ coke etc. was €5 which was unbelieveable really and a vodka and redbull for example was €11, extremely expensive even by Irish standards!!! As I mentioned we were part of a wedding, the wedding itself was lovely, we had our dinner outside inthe courtyard and the tables were set lovely..the food wasnt great (althou it must be said that perhaps this was because it was not what we were use to in terms of a typical Irish wedding dinner menu) octapus salad for starters, followed by raveolli, followed by beef and veg (which was ok) and desert. However the setting was really intimiate and lovely so it made up for it. Overall I would recommend a stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to stay somewhere with a bit of history, this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: AlinaSkyla
Reviews.Content: Mother and I (from Florida) spent four lovely days at the Qurinale. We heard of the place because a good friend in Argentina was gifted his stay for his 50th birthday (by a travel agent friend). It seemed like a logical choice at the moment and it turned out to be a gem of a choice. The room was well-appointed and very spacious. You can't hear the traffic. I loved the dressing room that separated the bathroom from the bedroom/ living room. Location is extraordinary. You can walk with suitcases from the train station. My 70 year old Mom wheeled hers. The metro is on the corner. Two McDonald's nearby. Nice ice cream shop in the gallery a block away. The "Internet Spot" is two blocks away and gave me good rates to call USA and send e-mails. The bus stops on that block. Ground floor sitting areas with free newspapers were nice. Everything is old, but well-kept. If you need to see modern hues, sleekness, chrome and sharp angles... this is not the place for you! The buffet breakfast was outstanding. Beautiful area to eat inside, outside on the veranda or on ground level. The patio and gardens were well-groomed. Plenty of choices plus attentive waitstaff made our day. The whole place had a feeling of being understated and classy. Concierge desk staff a bit surly. Marked difference when between attention received during weekdays and then the weekend e.g. ringing phones went unattended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: TiNKs106
Reviews.Content: Forget about any negative review that has been written on this hotel; the quirinale is simply fantastic. We've just been there for 6 nights and it was like heaven; having to leave was a huge struggle. The quirinale, with its amazing location, offers a lavish breakfast, an extra comfortable bed in airconditioned comfort, an outstanding elegant antique style, very romantic garden and amazing hygiene. It was just great returning to the hotel after a long day in eternal rome. Rome is one hell of a place, we've walked around each and every street, because trust me, the only way you can get across all the fabulous sites and ruins is on foot. For us, the quirinale has been a cherry on a fantastic cake called ROME.. We look forward to going again soon:)

Reviews.Title: “A four not five star hotel- Notacceptable air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: rlcrane
Reviews.Content: Very nice size rooms, good staff, although not all really bilingual, located in a convenient area but not as convenient, as fror exampe, the Spanish Steps. The only real complaint is the poor airconditioning . Our really nice room on the 5th floor could not be made less than 74-76 degrees. Note that the rooms at the same price vary greatly so that you need to get there early in the day during busy times to be able to select among available rooms. When we visited there were a number of business groups there which impacts on the atmosphere. A good place to stay for the price but not in hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: TTufty
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. We were near to the attractions and the railway station. Breakfast and lunch (part of the deal with CITALIA) in the garden were very pleasant but the breakfast was a bit basic and service at lunch can be a little slow. Overall though a wonderful stay and will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Logsy
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated our marriage in Rome, our wedding reception was held in the Quirinale, wow what can we say. Everything was even better than we had expected. We had 20 guests staying with us and they also have nothing but praise for the Quirinale. When we arrived to check in we were unable to go direct to our room as we were early re check in but have no fear as we were able to go to the garden bar / restaurant for a lovely cold drink in order to refresh after flight & 40 degree heat ! The night of our wedding reception was fantastic, honest the hotel could not do enough for us, even a power failure did not deter us - All power was gone in the hotel for a few hours but the hotel made the outside garden area so romantic with candles etc...It was nearly a pity when the lights came back on. We had a fantastic reception, the food was amazing with our weding guests still talking about it. Rooms were great, location of hotel brill with just a short stroll to the wonderfull Trevi fountain. In all the Quirinale were great to us as we had not visited same prior to our wedding. Thanks to everyone at the Quirinale & hope to see you soon Damien & Majella

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Wedding in The Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: Dangerfunk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our wedding at the Hotel Quirinale in April 2010 with around 100 guests staying in the hotel as well. All of our guests were really impressed with the hotel, it's location, decor and staff. As many of the other reviews of the Quirinale have pointed out, it is an older building and if you're looking for an ultra modern hotel this won't be for you. However the character of the building along with the service from the excellent staff, make it an great place to stay, whether you're hosting a large event as we were, of just as a base from which to explore Rome. The imperial Forae are a ten minute walk away; it's right beside the Metro and many sightseeing busses leave from Piazza della Repubblica which is just around the corner. The rooms are spacious (all with chandeliers) and the buffet breakfast is excellent. In our specific experience we can also say that the banqueting facilities are fantastic and that the hotel went to every length to make sure that we had a wonderful wedding. We appreciated this even more as our wedding was on April 23rd, right in the middle of the Volcanic ash flight disruptions so up to Thursday 22nd we were only able to confirm around 15 guests, having had to travel overland from Dublin ourselves. Sarita, who was in charge of our reception was very understanding and practical saying that she only needed around 24 hours notice of final numbers. Luckily the flight ban was lifted in time and 99% of our guests made it into Rome by lunchtime on thursday. Once we confirmed numbers with Sarita everything was ready on time, from menus to seating charts, food and drink to waiting staff. Everything went very smoothly in a week where nothing went to plan and the hotel was a huge part of that. We will definitely be staying in the Hotel Quirinale again and would recommend it to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night. We had two rooms beside each other. The rooms were tiny although the high ceiling made it seem bigger. The door to the room seemed odd and not overly secure. There was mold on the bathroom tile in one of the rooms. These rooms were in the lowest price category but I expected more from a 4 star hotel. On a positive note the breakfast was quite good and the air conditioning was excellent which was so appreciated in the Roman summer heat. Maybe there more expensive rooms are nicer as seen on their website but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Old Hotel - Quite Grand”
Reviews.Author: lordburnside
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Quirinale which is on Via Nazionale which is as hand place as any to stay in Rome. All attractions are in walking distance or near buses and Metro - it is only 200meteres from the train station. The hotel is quite grand. Our room was 14 feet high with curtains all the way. Large comfy double bed and proper wardrobe with parquet floor. Bathroom was mainly marble and the bath was massive with shower attachment. Breakfast was buffet style. Fruit, cerals, bacon, scambled eggs, eberything you could want and part of the large dining room was a terrace which overlooked a garden. All staff were friendly although reception could have smiled a bit more. My only criticism was the TV. You could watch TV and films and interent free for one day then pay 25 euros. However the free 24 hours did not work. As it happens I only watch foreign TV to see what its like - I dont go on holiday to watch tv.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: NunoMt
Reviews.Content: This hotel mistakes having old items with being classical. The building is nice, with a classical decoration that takes you back to other times, but it all feels a bit beat up. In out room we could feel the floor bend as we walked on it and it had also a bit of a squeaking sound. The door to the patio couldn't be closed properly. The breakfast was Ok, although the room is small and we had to stay in a table that's not even in the same room as the breakfast service because we couldn't find a table. The advantage here is that this other area has a good view to an internal garden. Other then the general old feeling, there was nothing particularly wrong with the hotel, but it just doesn't live up to the price they charge and doesn't have a minimum of a cozy feeling that an hotel should have. In terms of location it doesn't get a good score either, as it is far away from all the key interest points, and uphill when you come back at the end of the day. You are sure to get best value for less of your money in some better located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: msmith1522
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was very friendly and the rooms were simple and clean. We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. It is very close to the train station, so no need to take a taxi. The bus to all attractions is directly across the street from the hotel making it very convenient to get around. This hotel was a great find for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTT75
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, centrally located, friendly staff, comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: hmcfetridge
Reviews.Content: Quirinale Hotel is a great find! The accommodations are well-kept, and the service was fabulous! One of the bellhops saw that we were looking at our map, and came over and graciously took ten minutes to answer our questions and show us where to walk to see the best sights, etc. Breakfast was delicious, including eggs, sausage, bacon, cold cuts, cheeses, pastries, cereals, yogurts, teas, juices... anything you could want, they had! Our room was clean and pretty, and the shower had plenty of hot water. Hands down, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlmom
Reviews.Content: We bought a packaged and chose this hotel based on its location and amenities. Worried that my young daughter will not enjoy the place itself, we were surprised at the hospitality and amenities this hotel offered. The lobby was clean, though the rugs/carpet in the common room lack its luster, added personalized touch. Beware to visitors looking for a quiet solace at night. Majority of the rooms are facing the busy street. To our delight, there is a McDonalds close to the hotel~ an added bonus to the young visitor we tote along to this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, noisy and dirty hotel. Dont go there”
Reviews.Author: GGGSarnia
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome in business for a week and before I could check Tripadvisor my PA had booked me into the Quirinale. It is an awful hotel. Opens out onto a very noisy, dirty main road. When I arrived reception ignored me for about ten minutes preferring to talk among themselves and only turned around when I eventually shouted " service" My room overlooked the main road and was boiling hot when i entered. I opended the windows only to be hit by a wall of noise and traffic fumes. The AC did not work and when I complained i was told someone would fix it next week!! Food was bland and served by uninterested staff. Garden at back pleasant and quiet for a quiet drink and to read. the room was dirty, shower did not work and there were cracked tiles in the bathroom. The room was not cleaned everyday. terrible hotel - do not go there.

Reviews.Title: “Grand surroundings. Staff lacked warmth.”
Reviews.Author: medhead72
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an impressive lobby area and the adjoining seating area is fantastic. I booked two rooms and one was far more impressive than the other. Both rooms were a little tired but the better of the two rooms was both big and luxurious. Overall I enjoyed my stay although I left a disposable camera in one of the rooms. I e-mailed the hotel to try and get the item returned but no one replied. I also sent an email in advance of my stay and received no reply either. Customer service is in my experience a potential issue but otherwise a fine hotel and I would still stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A heritage experience”
Reviews.Author: indi_traveller07
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the morning after a long flight & were told to wait till 2 pm, which was frustrating. The reception staff speaks English but could offer little help in an early check-in. Though once past the reception, you will be attracted by the hotel’s elegance- large lobby, high doorways with heavy red curtains, chandeliers, old furniture and castle like long-corridors. The interiors are in heritage styling that explains older version of TV & bed which is a slight disappointment though the bathroom invites no adverse comments. The internet LAN connection is available on chargeable basis. The breakfast spread has very little of the warm stuff to offer & is repetitive. The USP of the hotel is its location- on the main happening street of Rome ‘Via Nationale’ and at stone’s throwaway distance from the Termini station Republica. Main destinations of Colloseum, Capitol hill, Fountain Trevi, Spanish steps are at walkable distances & the Vatican could be reached by the metro with metro exit just a few steps away. The two hidden treasure the hotel has a beautiful small garden in its rear and a large conference room. Overall, a recommended place, despite availability of several other options in the area mainly due to its charm & elegance which goes well with the feeling of ROMA.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Quirinale, stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lolly1603
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and would definitely recommend it to others. The location is perfect for walking to all the main tourist attractions, and is 50 metres from the metro "Republica" stop. The hotel itself is quite large with a beautiful garden located at the rear of the hotel - this is a lovely feature. We arrived at noon and were told the room wasnt ready til 2pm, which can be irritating, but we sampled the local tipple while waiting !!!! The bedroom was very large with high ceilings and chandelier- just as pictured on the website!! The bathroom was huge & well stocked with all toiletries, which were restocked every day. The hotel staff were helpful if not over-friendly. We had a room at the side of the hotel, and while it was noisy at times with traffic etc, this certainly didnt bother us too much. The breakfast was the usual hot & cold fayre & while it was nothing fantastic, it keep us satisfied while trekking around the streets of Rome during the day. Overall I would definitely reccommend this hotel to others. We used the price comparison link on this website and got a great deal through 1800hotels.ie - in fact it was so much cheaper than the other sites that I did worry if we would be sleeping in a broom cupboard during our stay! But need not have worried. Stay here - its good!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaH
Reviews.Content: It's a 4 start hotel but the services/rooms/facilities etc are not what you would expect from a 4 start hotel. Small rooms, some of them have old windows and you can feel the wind comming in. Also, you hear every step on the hallway like in a haunted castle :P But it has it's advantages: it's well positioned, you can reach lots of touristic points from Quirinale, especially because it's near the metro station. Good breakfast but it's the same every day, and you kind of get tired eating the same omlet for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: LynnL4
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, lobby was very large and comfotable. The rooms were small and the TV old. Internet connections came at an additional fee. The breakfast was complimentary and had a lot to choose from. The hotel is in walking distance to Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps. The subway is just a few blocks away and that will take you directly to Vatican City. Best of all it is a stone's throw from the train station. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tibey1204
Reviews.Content: Room was a little small but comfortable. Great location with staff that was always there to help. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Big!...Step Back in Time...”
Reviews.Author: Narathip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in easy walking distance from the main train station and has a Metro station within 100 m. (That is the main reason we picked this hotel for our first time in Rome). As you enter the hotel it's like stepping far far back in time to a Victorian era, and the staircases and the rooms reflect that. The bathroom was quite good size and clean but the furniture and bed reflects that era also. So, if you like something more modern do not even thing to stay in this hotel and do not consider this hotel for honeymoon or romantic weekend as the bed can be quite noisy to say the least. The Staff were quite helpful and breakfast was quite good but we would not repeat this exprience again.

Reviews.Title: “Piece of History”
Reviews.Author: GurgaonNomad
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip to Rome and stayed in the Quirinale. Only after I checked in, I came to know that I am being part of history because this was the first hotel built in Rome after reunification of Italy in 1860/61. And hence, the styling, the interiors, the rooms, everything is like a heritage structure with very high roofs and wooden floors etc and to match the old, all modern amenities also exist. My stay was decent, room was comfortable, but not luxurious, service was ok, location was excellant. It was walking to almost all famous monuments like Fontana de Trevi, Italian parliament, the Colosseum etc. Shopping was far too exepensive on this street, and so was the room rent. Lots of eateries near the hotel with a McDonalds right opposite the entrance. Walkable to the Terminale Railway station from where you could get a train to Leonardo da Vinci airport and vice versa for 11Euros one way as against the 40-50 Euros for a one way taxi ride. Room service has not too many options and the surprise was that they were not even serving pizzas. Would definitely recommend this hotel, however look for bargains and get it for 70-80 Euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “A total delight!”
Reviews.Author: diwa1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a really memorable stay at the Quirinale - met my expectations and more. Great room, with a balcony overlooking the garden - we watched the sun set over Rome whilst enjoying a glass of wine! The food in the hotel is excellent - breakfast extensive and of great quality - lunch was wonderful! The garden was a delight, especially given the wonderful sunshine we enjoyed. So easy to get out and about from the hotel - everywhere is easily reached on foot - we walked until we almost dropped! The staff are all professional and very willing to offer help and advice - Andreas on Reception and Mikeala in the restaurant particularly so. I chose the hotel because it is a well established, traditional hotel and it certainly lived up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitekat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in September. Really liked this hotel. It has alot of character. Its really central. Breakfast is lovely. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Every minute of my stay, Recommended”
Reviews.Author: sigg1404
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at around 1pm but they didn't let us in the room until 2pm. But that was their policy. The room was big. We had a fourth floor room facing the road. Although it is quite a busy room Via Nazzionale being so in the top floors we could hear anything except the enchanting sound of sirens which runs all day. They became our favourite italian song. The breakfast was superb. We enjoyed it very much. There is quite a good choice and you can take as much as you can. In fact we usually had a good breakfast that normaly took us whole day to eat something else. The hotel is so quite at the central that we used to go everywhere on foot, although later in the holiday we were begining to feel more tired. The staff was great too. Even when our airconditioning broke on our last night and they gave us a good room facing the garden. In my first room I used to have internet via some type of free internet. I used to connect my internet with this wifi. It is not the hotel's but used to surf the internet through this connection. If I remember right it was the Rome nights wi fi. Once I ate at the hotel and the food was exquisite. Although the price was a bit high but I enjoyed it. Nearby the hotel there is a pub that we used to go there at night to have some drinks with reasonably prices Last thing if I have to go to Rome once more I would choose again this hotel. Keep it up

Reviews.Title: “good price for value”
Reviews.Author: iltu
Reviews.Content: having a discounted rate, Hotel Quirinale is a beautifull solution to be very near the hearth of Rome. Perfect location if a venue in the Opera Theatre of Rome is your night event as a suggestive direct entrance to the Theatre is available. The lounge service is very accurate in the tradition of a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Snobbish unprofessional attitude, unquality dinner”
Reviews.Author: Rina-B
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation via Booking.com. As the hotel did not have a parking I cancelled a reservation and made a new one when my arrival arrangements have been changed. When I arrived at the hotel the staff could not find my cancellation (It was Sunday) and I was offered to find it by myself, print it and deliver it to them. I did not have my laptop with me and it hadn't occurred to the hotel staff to allow me to use their printer. On the next day when they found out that I HAVE cancelled my previous reservation none of them offered any apology for the unpleasant incident. In the evening we had dinner at the hotel restaurant. It was hardly adequate for a 4 star hotel and the price that it charges. Still, to be fair, breakfast was excellent. I stayed in this hotel 25 years ago and had wonderful memories of it. I think it would've been better just to stay with my memories.

Reviews.Title: “Pass this one by”
Reviews.Author: GeriGLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel due to it's proximity to the train station for an overnight in Rome. It was only a short cab ride from the station but from the moment we walked in to its noisy and hectic lobby we were disappointed. The front desk staff was uncooperative at the least (wouldn't even make change of a 5 euro bill) to downright rude. Our room was large but not attractive and not very comfortable. The hallway leading to it was wide but creepy in a dark 'The Shining' kind of way. I do have to give kudos to the bellman who tried, unsuccessfully in his Italian and my English, to get our internet service working. He was cheerful and pleasant, about the only staff member we met that I can say that about. And the bathroom was clean, recently updated, and nice-sized. Overall I'd say there are much better hotels for better value and service so keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Grand traditional Italian hotel”
Reviews.Author: EM12Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: Having read some previous reviews I was slightly nervous about our stay here but I need not have worried. I found the hotel staff polite and friendly. The few shallow steps(about 5 or 6) from the hotel reception to the lift were perfectly manageable and in fact a porter was on hand who took our bags to the lift and the room, if required. The Quirinale is a large hotel on a busy road but we had requested a quiet room and got one on the top floor overlooking the hotel garden. The room was spacious and furnished in traditional Italian style. The shower over the bath was not the best but that would be my only negative comment. The buffet breakfast was excellent with good range of hot and cold selection, and could be taken inside, outside in the garden or on the terrace overlooking the garden.The hotel is only 10 minutes from the main Rome railway station and in a good location for all the sights, either walking or picking up one of the hop - on, hop-off bus tours.If going to the Coliseum and offered a tour outside by a guide I would recommend taking it as you jump the queue and the commentary from our guide was excellent and very animated. However this may have been pot luck, as our tour around the Vatican was spent trudging streets for the first hour out of 2.5 hours, being taken to a gift shop, waiting for radios. Having said that when it actually did start the guide's commentary did 'make ' the visit. It was expensive for this tour and I can't make up my mind if worth it. Back to the Quirinale, I would recommend staying here as for the reasonable rate that we paid it was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough...”
Reviews.Author: MiamiGirl17
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pretty small if you're used to American sized hotel rooms. The staff/front desk is friendly. However, do NOT ask the front desk for recommendations on where to have dinner. They recommended a pretty bad one (Terme di Diocleziano) and it seems like they get kickbacks for the recommendations. Anyway, the rooms are clean. Breakfast was wonderful, probably the best amenity of the hotel. Walking distance (about 15 minutes) to Vastours center where all our tours began.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected and heartily recommended”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforpleasure
Reviews.Content: Some reviewers have not appreciated this hotel. It is a classic design (mid 1800s) and in Rome is all the better for it. Fittings are clean and not worn and everything is kept very clean. The breakfast buffet is far better than a continental breakfast and the restaurant overlooks a well kept garden with an open terrace.It has spacious public areas to chill out. It is a great location just 50m from Republica tube and bus stops are outside. The rooms, for a city hotel, are surprisingly spacious and we had a very comfortable six foot bed. My only criticism of the plumbing was the temperamental shower but the bathroom did have a bidet. Towels were changed daily and the room had air conditioning. It overlooked not a lot and was quiet but some rooms will overlook the busy street, but that is city life for you!. The staff spoke adequate English and were polite and delivered a fax promptly and to my room. Local phone calls appear to be free (we were not charged). There is the usual menu of TV channels, including films and English and quite expensive broadband options. Overall heartily recommended with no hesitation to return. Some tips for those staying there All soft drinks and water in Rome are expensive. Mc Donalds is only 60m away (out of door turn right and on roundabout) and has cheapish drinks inc water. Buy a Roma pass from the newstand , out of door turn right for 50m, and get entry to the Coliseum (and others) and 3 days on the buses and tubes for a value price. Even if we had not used the transport bypassing the horrendous queues at the Coliseum was worth it. Do not be tempted by the inflated prices here for the Vatican. They have much better systems to get in, without queuing so buy them at the door. The open top tour is great and leaves from outside McDonalds (Open city green buses). 2 days are little more cost than one day so you can use it as transport as a hop on and off service. Very regular but only till mid evening and posssibly a little slow if you're crossing town in a hurry. The Rome pass is inserted in the ticket machine in the public buses so that's another way to travel to all the major sights. Rome is walkable but you'll cover miles at the sights and the cobbled streets may tire you. Avoid the taxis, even the official ones (SPQR logo). The Termini station( direct line to airport) is only 300m away yet the cab took the long way and charged 28 Euros! Walk or take tube for one stop). Avoid the train from the airport if you have heavy luggage as there are several steps up to get into the train (and off) and for an airport express not luggage friendly. We booked a hop on minibus for the return journey which is pre booked, picks up from the hotel and for two people not much more expensive than the train Navona square is really recommended for street life and entertainment and al fresco eating but like most eating out in Rome, not that cheap About 80 Euros for two with one drink each. So in summary, both the hotel and Rome are heartily recommended. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: BasilEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel for a 4 night stay for me, my wife and friends I was a bit apprehensive after reading some previous reviews. However, it turned out to be a great choice. The interior of the hotel is very spacious and you do not get any sense of overcrowding. Our rooms were on the 4th floor and overlooked the gardens (I can understand people being unhappy if they got a room with no view). They were clean and reasonably spacious with very nice bathrooms. Bed linen, towels and bathroom accessories were changed every day. Breakfast choice was terrific with cold and hot choices available. Staff were friendly and very helpful when asked questions. The hotel is in a great location for walking to almost all the sites. Obviously if you look closely it could do with some freshening up in some areas but overall it was perfect for our stay in Rome. I would certainly return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: USAbjc
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We booked a triple and a double to accommodate us, and found both rooms to be very clean and spacious. The rooms had very high ceilings, antique furniture, and new bathrooms. The hotel was very convenient to all of the sights we wanted to see, as most of our sightseeing was done on foot. There is Metro station about 1 block away, but plan on walking to many of the places you go (the Metro system in Rome is quite limited, only having two train routes, but we used it to travel to Vatican City and the Coliseum). The breakfast at the hotel was excellent, and the staff at the front desk was friendly. WiFi is only available in the Lobby, and is NOT free of charge. The hotel will give you 2 free hours, and then you have to pay a fee to use the Internet beyond that. To use the internet in your room, you have to use a CAT5 cable, and there is a different set of fees associated with that. We arrived by train at Termini station from FCO airport, and decided to walk with our baggage, because the hotel is supposed to be only about 400 yards -- it seemed to be quite a bit longer, because of the proximity of the Platform to the other end of the Train Station. I'd recommend taking a cab, as it was mainly an uphill walk with quite a bit of luggage. The cab rid will not cost much, as it is a short ride by car. Overall, great pick, and I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we expected”
Reviews.Author: RosieNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying here - at the end of a European trip. But the reception staff were - at best - disinterested. The room we were given (despite having paid a hefty price through our travel agent) was a very small back room - with a window that faced a brick wall. The beds were extrememely uncomfortable and the pillows rock-hard. For a 4 star hotel - it was a 2 star experience, and we would NEVER stay there again - ever!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: IndabaYork
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers, we arrived not quite sure what to expect due to mixed comments and especially as we had prepaid to take advantage of their special low rate. Reception was friendly and professional and from there on eveything was spot on. Porterage to assist with cases, excellent bar service with a 'happy hour' in the early evening, delightful garden area and a very good restaurant for dinner. The 20 per cent discount offered to residents dining made it a very reasonable cost. Breakfast buffet was very good with a large selection of dishes. Our bedroom on the 2nd floor was very large but did suffer from main road noise - next time would insist on a garden / back facing room. Location of the hotel is convenient for buses / trains and many of the main tourist sights are walkable. All told a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Refined hotel in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: irishfreespirit
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from this hotel for a quick weekend stay in Rome. I was cautious at first with some of the reviews but the hotel i expected was far different from the reality. Very reasonable for a 4 star hotel in Rome with a central location for under £100 GBP a night. The Quirinale is a typically italian hotel with some distinguished guests over the years. Large wood panelled bedrooms with period furniture, air conditioning and amazingly comfortable beds. Breakfast in the morning is a buffet with a wide range on offer including continental, cooked breakfast and fresh fruit. Staff were friendly and helpful even for an Italian hotel. Location is spot on with everything accessable in 15 minutes walk and a metro spot in a matter of meters If you like your hotels refined with comfort in mind this is definately a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Lovely traditional Italian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoeboey
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at this hotel and one thing that suprises me about the other reviews is the comments on the service. During my stay the service was excellent throughout! They gave me really good restaurant suggestions, they helped me find which bus to catch and which stop to get off when I needed to get to a meeting a bit furtehr out of the city and they also printed me off maps on how to find places etc when I asked. The style of the Hotel is classic and elegant so high ceilings, chandeliers in the bedrooms, traditional furniture, porter service on arrival that kind of thing. It is traditional Italian through so not like a Westin or a Radisson with wall to wall carpets and modern styling etc. but when I stay somewhere I like to feel the atmosphere of the desitnation so it suited me well. The breakfast was plentiful and yummy, nice pastries, not much cereal selection though, I love my Muesli but they didn't have any at all. The garden restaurant/bar is a lovely setting, just nice for an evening aperitif in the summer. My room was a standard and it was quite large. You entered into a corridor with a bathroom off one side and the bedroom off the other, so not just your standard box. Not sumptuous decoration i.e bare floorboards not carpets, high cealings . But I did have a beautiful large chandelier and nice new rugs on the floor. The bathroom looked a little old, but was large and spotless. my shower worked very well, and I had a lovely bath to saok myself after a hard days work.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Ricardfred
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not worth the high price we paid. Desk staff were totally disinterested and almost rude. Room was very basic and bathroom was cramped. They ignored email I sent asking for 2 twin rooms and close together. Bed was terrible and sank. Air con did not work and room was very warm despite having high ceiling and being spacious. Internet cost 15 euro to use, another rip-off. Place is tired looking. The good points were that room was well cleaned and bathroom spotless. Breakfast which was included was fine and had a nice area overlooking the small garden. We paid 220 a night. 100 would be more than enough. Rome is amazing so thankfully did not have to spend much time at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “comfortably convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kokv1432
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and the Quirinale was a great start to our vacation. We found the staff to be professional and very responsive to our inquiries about directions and restaurant suggestions. We found our room to be clean, quiet and comfortable, and actually larger than what we had expected. Our stay included breakfast, and I was amazed at the variety of food and beverages presented in the breakfast buffet. We found everything to be fresh and of very good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off – No such thing as a Free Lunch – Don’t be fooled !”
Reviews.Author: KK_TravellersIreland
Reviews.Content: I booked a weeks “holiday” in Rome with Cititalia – this was an 8 day stay (8th night included free, with “a free lunch including wine, every day” ) included in the price. Upon arrival, we were met with a Basil Fawlty style greeting - I actually thought we were in the wrong hotel when we walked through the doors – this establishment is in no way worthy of its 4 star rating – more like a 2 star rating at most. The “gentlemen” at reception kept us waiting an age before checking us in. They were rude and brusque. A porter was assigned to us to bring us and our baggage to our room. The first room were were taken to (on the 2nd floor), was appalling – dark and dank, with 1 double bed – we are two ladies and had requested when booking with Citialia, for a twin room – 2 twin beds. I had even rang to double check this in advance of making the booking and it was duley noted on the booking documents that were posted out to me. We alerted the porter to this, who rang reception, and, after much deliberation and shouting !! on the phone, we were taken to a room on the 4th floor, at the front of the building. Room was large and clean, but very VERY basic. It had a wooden trouser press that exhibited the latest in wireless technology (This was similar to one found in the Villa of Lucius Calpurnius circa 1 A.D !!). The “bathroom” had been installed by the romans in circa 549 B.C !! – the shower had a boiling hot dribble of water, the taps in the sink shot water out in bursts which went everywhere except the sink ! The ancient plumbing was directly connected to the Cloaca Maxima, and was constructed in the time of Tarquinius Priscus .There was a coating of mould on the shower curtain, which had previously been installed in the Diocletian circa 305A.D. There was 1 electricity plug point in the entire room, and our room was connected to another room via a small passage and a locked door. You could hear EVERYTHING from the guest room next door ( when the sound of passing traffic on the street outside abated). There was no air conditioning so I can only imagine what the heat would be like on the summer months in that room ( it was 540 by the way). Traffic passing by the front of the hotel, caused our room to vibrate – casting serious doubt over the soundness of the structure and foundations of this ancient construction. Now, to the “Free Lunch” debacle. As per Citialia’s website and brouchure, our 8 night B&B package included a free lunch each day with wine. When we checked in we were given 8 paper vouchers for lunch, which we were instructed to present at the dining room upon arrival each day, which we duly did. The food itself was bland ,but we didn’t complain, as it was free. The menu itself did not change over the entire 8 days, and we were given a ½ bottle of house red or white wine each day, which was fine. Ordering food, and its delivery to the table, was a job in itself – surly staff hurled startes and main courses out at the same time, insisted on serving side orders AFTER the meal,deserts were the leftover deserts from the previous evening meal and arrived up to 30 minutes later. We were offered mineral water with each lunch, which we accepted, and offered tea and coffee after each lunch, which we also took. Now, for the sting in the tail – when we were checking out, we were presented with a bill ! – please note that we had paid Citialia in full for the holiday when we booked in advance of our arrival at the hotel, so this charge of €120.00 was a mystery. When I asked what this charge related to, I was initially told it was the charge for each lunch ? – I produced the Citialia booking receipts which detailed the “free daily lunch with wine”, which was snatched out of my hand by the ever courteous man on reception. There was much deliberation between the 3 –Amigo’s behind the desk. The man returned and said the charges were for the wine, I said no, and again pointed out “free lunch including wine”. He again conferred with the board and upon return declared that the charge was for tea’s and water ! – which, conveniently cost €6.00 for the large bottle of water and €4.50 for each tea/coffee (we had 1 bottle of water and 2 tea’s with each lunch). This was never made clear in Citialia’s brouchure, receipts, or by the Rep – who I rang when this debacle was going on. The man at reception shouted and roared at us, insisting the charges were for wine, and when I showed him the Citialia documents, he said he didn’t give a [--] what Citialia said !! This all occurred in front of other hotel guests, and was mortifying. Every night, there is “live music” which comprises of the same guy, who plays the same set of songs. The place is shabby, old furniture, which has seen better days. The flowers in the main lounge, were never changed the entire 8 days. When we were leaving, no one offered to help with bags etc. I would advise to avoid at all costs. This is not for the faint hearted - bad service, bad food, below par facilities and blatant thievery are all what makes the Quirinale what it is - Monte Testaccio !

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned grandeur at its best”
Reviews.Author: Holly08cork
Reviews.Content: Hotel Quirinale is quietely situated on Via Nazionale and all attractions are within walking distance. Having read previous reviews, I didnt know what to expect really. However, the room was spacious although there is some disturbance from traffic outside. The staff were mostly helpful. There was a discount in the hotel diningroom for guests for evening meal which made it very affordable. Dining Room staff were efficient and courteous. However the menu remains the same every day. Breakfast was inviting with plenty of choice and food was contstantly replaced. In the event of a return visit, I would book same hotel again. Rome has an unbeatable atmosphere and is a wonderful city to visit .

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: elmomoses
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location and its suitability to my grandmother who was coming with me to Rome. I was not disappointed. This hotel delivered on everything it promised. It was located in close proximity to everything, on a street that boasts a wide variety of restaurants, shops and bars. We ate in the restaurant as being older my gran wasn't in to Italian food, and the standard was topnotch, with the waiter being very helpful and courteous. Some people have reviewed the hotel bar and lobby as old, needing an update, but we loved its old world interior. The bar staff wore white tuxedo jackets, and this, with the piano playing classical and contempory tunes, menat that it was easy to imagine a time when the hotel was host to artists and politicans. The breakfast is self service which got a bit messy when it was busy, but there was a great choice. The rooms were clean and the comfortable, with a large bathroom. Just be advised that rooms to the front expose you to traffic noise, and I will request a room to the back the next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rapallo
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about this hotel, we decided to split our week in Rome into 2 hotels. We stayed 3 nights there. The location is very good -- walking to train station, metro. Most of the attraction sites are within 20 minutes walk. The room we got was spacious, no view, but quiet. The bathroom has been totally renovated. Our breakfast was included in the room rate. The buffet was not spectacular, but was good. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: BrookeSara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Albergo Quirinale for four nights in February 2009. Overall a pleasant stay. I was assigned one of their least favored rooms, with a most unpleasant view. I requested a different room with a better view and also requested a room with a bathtub. I was very appreciative that they granted my request and reassigned my room to a side street (Via Torino), and was granted my request of a room with a bathtub. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty in a very attractive dining room. There is also outside dining overlooking a pretty courtyard, but the weather was chilly and I opted to stay inside. The hotel is decorated in antiques and has an old world charachter that to some may not be to their liking. I rather enjoy the past and if in Rome, old world is my choice. My one disappointment is the fact that this hotel charges a rather steep fee for internet use. Being a single female traveler, Internet use is a number one priority to me, as this is my way to communicate with family back home to keep them informed of my whereabouts as I travel through. The high price this hotel charges for internet use prevented me from using the service. I strongly believe that this service should be provided to guests free of charge, or at least at a reasonable rate. Eight Euros for 1 hour of internet service is excessive, and I'm afraid is a way to gouge the guests for extra revenue after we have already paid for our room. For this reason alone, I WILL NOT BE RETURNING to the Quirinale, unless they revise their policy for internet use.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints - would stay again without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: marcolet
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Quirinale for the second time last week for 5 nights and have no complaints at all. We had a deluxe room on the 4th floor and it was very spacious. The bathroom was enormous. The room was facing the side street but not noisy at all. The rooms are old style but this just adds to the charm - if you are looking for modern - go elsewhere. The only thing missing was a tea/coffe maker - not a big issue. Breakfast was included in the price and included juices/tea/coffee/cereals/fruit/yogurt/bacon/eggs/bread/cold meats/cheese/cakes - you would definitely find somthing to eat - could not complain. Not sure what some reveiws who complain expect for their breakfast!! There is a lovely comfortable foyer in the hotel. The reception staff are pleasant. There is internet access in the rooms but no printer - internet cafe around the corner if you need to print boarding passes or anything. There is a lovely garden - lovely in the summer and overlooked by the terrace where breakfast is served - not open this time around - too cold to eat out There were a few of us staying and the rooms definitely differ - but all of the rooms were fine - some a little more spacious than other Would stay again. Location is walking distance of many sights and very close to the Republics Square Metro stop. Plenty places around to eat and have a drink. Would have no hesitation recommending hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, but do your research...”
Reviews.Author: thistle11
Reviews.Content: I can't speak for everyone's stay at this hotel, but we had a great experience. We booked three nights at Albergo Quirinale via Gate1 (bundled with airfare, breakfast buffet included) during a wet December (b/t Xmas and New Year). The hotel isn't the cheapest, but it is convenient, spacious and pretty, and the staff is nice and helpful (English-speaking, friendly and knowledgeable). Many of the amenities are, in fact, superb. There seems to be a lot of discussion about the "four star/three star" status of Quirinale on tripadvisor reviews here. Look--it's not a budget hotel, but few hotels in Rome are; however, if you get the unlimited breakfast buffett, you can stuff yourself with food and really work the location so you save and see everything (it's hard to get a better place of operations, esp with the ROMA Pass rail/bus savings). And you'll enjoy your time there. Do some research, though: Piazza della Repubblica is about 2 minutes by foot, so you can foot it to buses (the 910 for the Galleria Borghese), the 40 Express to the Vatican (stops two feet in front of the hotel, opposite side of Via Nazionale) and subway. The Baths of Diocletian and the National Museum can be walked to as well in about 5 mins. The main post office is three blocks away; ATMs/banks are plentiful on both sides of the street; Roma Termini is 10 minutes by foot to the south; Santa Maria della Vittoria, with Bernini's Ecstasy of St. Teresa (and other churches, including San Carlino delle Q.Fontane--all free) are about 10 minutes away. The Trevi is walkable, too, along with the Palazzo Barberini. ... If you need them, there are also magazine stands and vendors close by (but the hotel has English/international newspapers in lobby), and a small, charming supermarket down the road on the opposite side of street will furnish you with the rest of your needs. In terms of the hotel itself, it adjoins the Opera House (Verdi stayed there), and staff can tell you how to book tix for performances. You can expect the sculpture courtyard to be full of people in warm weather, and the Sala Verdi (where the buffet is served) to be packed in high season, but that's typical. Ditto for the restaurant (mid-range in terms of price, but delicious) and the bar. There's a postal drop by the desk for international/domestic mail, and the elevator works (the bathrooms by the lobby are also clean, and may also be handy for you--Italy's WC situation is, travel-wise, something to be aware of). It was still holiday-festive inside when we were there (Christmas tree, warm fire, music in the evenings), so summer may be very different in terms of atmosphere, etc. We were on the 5th Floor, and it was quiet, but there was some noise from a nearby room with a family for an hour or so (always bring earplugs on holiday). Room had a safe, very good windows, and a double door, and the beds (two twins pushed together, per Italian custom) had marquetry with pastoral scenes, as did the cabinets. TV was great (flatscreen, many channels), and the bathroom/shower worked perfectly well and was stocked and spacious (minibar ditto). Ask for an interior room ("una camera tranquilla, interiore") so you don't get one overlooking the noisy Via Nazionale. As with all services in Italy, a little Italian goes a long way in terms of help and friendliness. Note: in some reviews, you will hear that a hotel's "AC shut off for the afternoon" or that "the heat didn't work for five hours!!!" That's not the hotel's fault: that's Italy--by national law as an energy-saving measure, they shut off the heat/AC at times to save on power. A bit of research might alleviate this concern; so maybe if they bought a Rick Steves guide they'd save on stress before the trip, instead of spending more energy and time worrying when in Italy? Anyway, the Hotel Quirinale isn't the Four Seasons, but it has charm and is very convenient. We would definitely stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it! I usually stay at the Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: LuvNicaragua
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading all the different reviews. It was everything we expected and more. Wonderful location, staff was perfect and helpful and the rooms were clean and nice. Even the sheets were of my standard. Greatly surprised. We took our 3 teenagers and for the first time there were no complaints. We could walk to everything. Yes the food is expensive but the food was above par. First class chef and service. The lobby/bar made the trip even better. They offered the Best New Years Eve Party too. While teenagers were at the Coliseum, the hotel offered the most wonderful get together of people all over the world. The Piano player was great. I agree to take note of comments but our mattress was perfect and our room had an awful view. Who cared? WE only slept there. You can choose another room if you don't like the first one they show. Just ask nicely and they are more than accomodating. You get what you pay for and more here. If you want the Ritz then pay for the Ritz. I left the Quirinale feeling like I had experienced Rome first class on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: acs44
Reviews.Content: The Quirinale is a lovely old hotel, but some of the rooms, at least, leave much to be desired. We had requested a courtyard room, but unfortunately received one that could be considered a courtyard only if that interpretation included the physical plant (trash, heating, a/c, etc) The common areas of the hotel are beautiful and as an antiques dealer, I can attest that the art and furnishings are really nice. I would just recommend that you ask to see a room before you actually unpack your bags. Some are definitely better than others. The location is very good -- only a few blocks from the Termini Station and the city bus stop is just outside the front door. I most likely won't stay there on my next visit, only because I want to see what else is available. But if this hotel suits your pocketbook and purposes, it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: new_globetrekker
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 4 star hotel. More like a 3 star. Read many of the mixed reviewes on Tripadvisor. Based on reviews, Quirinale wasn't my first or second or even third choice, but since the better reviewed hotels in my price range were fully booked I booked the Quirinale. I didn't feel good about it and worried right up to arrival. My concerns were warranted. I still booked this hotel because I really wanted to stay in a hotel located around the center of Rome. There were definately better hotel options outside of Rome's center with better pricing, but I really wanted to be able to walk to all the major sights. The good. Location. Can't be beat. I was within walking distance to all the major sights. Despite other poor reviews, I found the service staff to be courteous and helpful. Many of the staff spoke english which was very helpful. The hotel overall was in good condition. Like one reviewer commented, it has potential to be great. Very happy with the bathroom. Modern and clean. Internet connection via ethernet cable. (But at $15 euro/night. With the current exchange rate, that's $20/night! I'm used to paying around $12-$15/night at hotels.) The bad. The room. I booked a single room through hotels.com. Had no idea that single meant their tiny room with a twin sized bed. I felt claustrophobic. The booking through hotels.com wasn't cancellable at that point, so I didn't have the option of leaving and going to another hotel. I paid another 50 Euros/night to upgrade to the deluxe double room which was the size of an average hotel room in the states. The deluxe room had two twin beds. I never got used to sleeping in the small twin bed. And I'm only 5'4" 130 lbs. The mattress was old and lumpy. I felt all the springs in the mattress. Slept with back pain the entire 6 nights of my stay. The springs seemed old. When I rolled to either side, the springs sank in and I felt like I was going to roll off. Also the door to the room hung crooked and wasn't sized right. There was a 2 inch gap in the bottom. The hall light floods in at night. Noise from the hallway is very loud when people walk by. The complementary breakfast was ok, but I ordered spaghetti through room service. It was pretty bad. If they could just update the furniture in the rooms and replace the door, it could be a 4 star hotel I could recommend. Not the worse hotel. Just average. Doesn't live up to the 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “potential to be great!”
Reviews.Author: maryber
Reviews.Content: I do all my research with Tripadvisor before selecting a hotel so when I was informed this is where our party would be staying I rushed to read what had been written by previous guests. I was concerned by its low rating. It's decor would not appeal to me, but I went with an open mind. I could relax as the blame would not fall on me if it was disappointing! Locationwise it is faultless. It is on a main street, close to several attractions, bars restaurants and shops. Pricewise it was average, but I believe we could get a better hotel for less. money. This hotel could be amazing, in had class, character, high ceilings, marble stairs., but it needs a serious face lift. It had a jaded, faded look to it. The carpets and curtains were ancient, the paint work was a cheap lick and promise. The furniture was old but shabby. There was a sparce, convent feel to the whole place. In fairness the bed was really comfortable, the linen was good quality, the bathroom was spotless and very well kitted out. The whole hotel was really clean. The breakfast room was beautiful but the breakfast was nothing special and everything was whisked away very promptly. All staff were polite and efficient. This hotel has stiff competition, it needs money spent on it, but customers would flock to it if they would only raise the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor Food and Worse Service”
Reviews.Author: danielb_8
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, within walking distance of Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, the Pantheon and lots of restaurants. Breakfast buffet was mediocre at best. Room was large and well furnished. Street construction forced us to schlep bags down the street for a couple blocks to and from our bus. Front desk was terrible. After an all night flight they were unable to get us into a room a single minute before the 3 p.m. gurantee even though we had reservations and they made up and offered us a double while we waited in the lobby even though we required a triple. An efficient staff would have prioritized the triple. Another from our group asked for their money back or a room before 3 p.m.. They got a room. If you are willing to put up with the staff it is a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough property not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: hypathia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a main street called Via Nazionale. This street is very busy with many shops selling clothing and shoes. At the time that I was there the road was being worked on. So there was dust, dirt and noise. Most of the street was fenced off and backhoes abounded. I arrived in the afternoon and was dropped off on the sidewalk as there is no parking or drop off area in front of the hotel. I entered the hotel and was greeted politely, I asked for a very quiet room off of the street side of the hotel as I had just come from a very long flight. The room was located on the third floor the view was nothing to look at but the room was very quiet. The bed was comfortable, and the linens clean. The bathroom had a bidet and toilet in one. The shower however left much to be desired. It was tiny and I found it impossible to get really clean. The shower head shot water out in every direction except down. The water varied from freezing to scalding to warm and the drain filled to the point of overflowing the tiny shower floor then drained suddenly with authority. I am 5'2 and 125 pounds and the shower was small for me. Also there was no hot water in the sink to brush your teeth. My room was clean and spacious other than the tiny shower. The free breakfast consisted of cereals, fruit, cheese, meat, eggs, yogurt, pastries, breads, coffee and tea. The hotel itself is an older building that tries to maintain a clean well kept interior. The hotel is five minutes’ walk to the train station if you are in good health. 15 minutes if you walk slow. The closest church of interest Santa Maria della Vittoria housing the Bernini sculpture of the Ecstasy of St. Teresa is about five to eight minutes walk from the hotel. I would try another hotel given a return trip but in a pinch I would return to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful reception at Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: ninadel
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception at the Quirinale and it was magical. I could not fault anything. I had never been to Rome before so all the organising was done by email with the very efficient Barbara Meneghello who organised hair, makeup, flowers, menus etc. We had a wonderful reception into the early hours thanks to the in-house pianist entertaining our guests and our suite was perfect for pre-wedding photographs and getting ready with bridesmaids and flowergirls. The food, service and decor was all excellent and the location was great as we could walk to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Colosseum and Central Station. Couldn't recomment it highly enough. Hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Anniversary08
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic time in Rome to celebrate our Ruby Wedding. Stayed at the Quirinale and could not fault it Room was lavish (Room 501)more of a suite! Breakfast buffet, eaten on the Garden Terrace was excellent with plenty of choice.Reception staff helpful at all times. Did read some of the adverse reviews before booking but after having been to the hotel I wonder whether I have been to the same one that some reviewers found so bad!!
