Well situated for Termini Station (10 mins walk). Would definitely stay again and recommend hotel to prospective visitors. Alan Herricks Manchester UK

Reviews.Title: “Old and shabby”
Reviews.Author: Miauova
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Quirinale only because the hotel at which I stay usually was booked. I am a business traveller. I really did not like this hotel. It is very shabby, pretending to be special and stylish. It was clean and they have indeed good cushions (as they advertise), but that's all. The breakfast was very poor (even for an Italian standard) - coffee from a machine (not a real one), 2 kinds of cheap cheese and salami and a scrambled egg, jam & butter. The problem was that the dinning room was full so only available tables were outside which may be a problem if it rains or in winter... They have a lovely garden which, except cushions, is the only thing worth it. The room has an old furniture and the old closets have a smell as if nobody opened them for 50 years. Bathroom is simple and rather small. The avarage age of the guests I met was around 60, so I guess if this is your age group you may like it. I certainly do not recomend it for young people or those that like light, modern style.

Reviews.Title: “best service and great wedding”
Reviews.Author: PamelaandBarry
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came on Sunday for our wedding on Wednesday at San Silvestro. From the beginning of my preparations for our drinks/dinner reception, the staff were wonderful and upon our arrival, everything was organised, dealt with professionally and helped us relax for our big day. A particular mention to Sarita and the other 'girls' in the office, who helped us reserve a rehearsal dinner on the tuesday, and made sure that everything was done for Wednesday. It was relaxed, spontaneous and ultimately, the perfect day. The hotel has gone through a total renovation, and even my american family who have travelled alot, were impressed with the service, the rooms and overall, enjoyed their stay as well. I strongly recommend this hotel and if you are thinking of getting married in Italy - this hotel is used to irish brides and will do everything to assist, including helping my bridesmaid find a flower market - as my husband and I were travelling to Australia for our honeymoon, we gave our flowers to Sarita and the other girls as a heart-felt thanks. The rooms were clean, quiet (on the garden side) and our juniour suite that we moved into on our wedding night and the following night was amazing. Come to Rome and experience the charm of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: ALDaniel
Reviews.Content: We were married here, at hotel quirianle, July 25, 2008. We did not know what to expect after reading all of the mixed reviews, but we fell in love with this beautiful old hotel. The hotel staff in the morning was exceptional. They helped all of our 20 guests coordinate together, and delivered all of our gift boxes to the rooms without complication. The dinner at the reception was amazing the chef and the maitre d`, Petar, made everything on our wedding night unforgettable. It is an older hotel, but very spacious, and very centrally located. The service was pretty great considering all of our demands, but you also have to remember in Italy they are more laidback and casual about things. The rooms were all different, ours had a huge balcony and large sitting area. The free breakfast was excellent compared to the hotels we stayed at in Venice, Positano, and Florence. Many of our guests had visited Rome before and they all agreed that it was one of the best hotels they have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Quiet, and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Travlin2
Reviews.Content: Our stay was nice and we enjoyed this hotel for it's uniqueness, Renassiance feel, and central location to most of the common tourist sites - some within a 10-15 minute walk. Other reviews are correct in that it is centrally located. However, instread of the bus and/or train, we used the subway/Metro for our transportation around town (even from our arrival at Ostiense Train Station which is East of the Colloseum). There is a Metro stop within a 1 minute walk from the hotel lobby. The Metro/subway is so easy to use and very inexpensive. The hotel staff we found VERY nice and VERY helpful with our questions and needs. We found them to be quick and attentive to a couple of our room needs as well. One female staff member even made a call for me to confirm our "pick-up" transportation. The hotel's common and public areas are attractive and well kept. Some "displays" - pictures, antiquities, etc. in the stair wells and room halls, are a little old, beat up, and probably need to be cleaned up or fixed. However, the other common grounds are well kept. Our room was large and so was the bath. It was clean and well kept each day. We were pleased with the house-keeping. Most of this hotel - including the guest rooms - are NOT carpeted. Harwood floors throughout. Again, a Renassiance feel throughout with decor and paint. Our room was quiet and did not face the VERY BUSY street in front of the hotel. didn't have much of any view, but we didn't care. The breakfast, we thought, was very good. Very well presented and the breakfast staff was VERY attentive to all of the guest needs. They kept it well stocked and were always moving and cleaning. The breakfast area was very nice and pleasant. You could eat in one of three locations - inside, on the nice porch, or in the garden. Overall, we felt very comfortable and well served at this hotel. We were very pleased and I want to thank the desk staff for all their assistance in answering our questions and meeting our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Old World Flavor”
Reviews.Author: love2travel814
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in Rome over the past few years of traveling there. We enjoyed our stay at the Quirinale Hotel. Everything in our room worked just perfectly and the beds were comfortable. This is a busy area, and there is lots of shopping. You must walk towards the Spanish Steps to see some great small restaurants. The National Museum is across from the train station. We enjoyed our stay on the last leg of our trip and would certainly stay again. A good value!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad and good value for a central rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJON
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in Aug. Flew into Campino airport and got a taxi directly t/from hotel (40Euro..pay no more). You can also get a bus to/from the central station for approx 18 euro and walk 10 mins to the hotel if you wish. Hotel is 4star anbd costs about UK£125/night. Not really a 4star hotel but the room and bathroom was clean, airconditioned and large enough. Don't expect anything to extravegent for this price. Good value though, expecially if you are out for most of the day anyway. Too often the hotels rooms in Rome are overpriced and tiny. Located very centrally, one the main bus routes and a good location for easy walking to any area.The central station is within 5 mins walk of the hotel. The central station also hosts the city tour buses and this is well worthwhile to do first in your first day or two to get to know the city and main attraction/locations and then just walk to everything afterwards. The weather was great - 30+DegC -shorts and Tshirt weather. Lots of restaurants aroudn the hotel area, mainly pizza/pasta type food but ok with a few other more expecnsive restaurants around as well. Would recommend the International Bar down a few streets down from the hotel for some reasonable local food/selection and good wine. I would go back although there are a few more similar type hotels along the same street worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, overpriced and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Glasker
Reviews.Content: Hotel has the atmosphere of having once been grand and elegant; now it's just shabby with tired decor and beds that can only be described and akin to prison cots. The breakfast was plentiful but not very appetizing, and usually cold. The staff were at best civil and worst ignorant and rude (and always unhelpful). During our stay we had personal belongings stolen from the room during the 2 hours we were out that day for our wedding (very nice of them to pick the day when they knew we weren't in because they booked our wedding cars!). The manager and reception staff washed their hands of it, despite me hoiking (at their insistence) to the police station in my dress to report it that day, and told me that thefts during cleaning by the staff were 'not their problem'. Overall, I found the hotel to be overpriced and most definitely not worth the time and money. The rooms were basic, only barely cleaned, and the sheets not changed once during the 7 days we spent there. We booked it especially for our wedding based on good reviews and were really really disappointed. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and great location”
Reviews.Author: maluvsart
Reviews.Content: We traveled through Sicily and onto Italy in June 2008. We stayed at about 8 hotels during our tour. The Quirinale was by far our most enjoyable hotel. For those who can appreciate and want high Italian ambiance, salons with original art and a friendly staff, this is the place for you. It is centrally located near the Piazza della Repubblica. The restaurant was pricey but great and we had our own private patio overlooking the beautiful garden where the likes of Pucciini, Verdi and Caruso were hosted. The Rome Opera House is located behind the hotel and has a separate entrance from the hotel. We would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Roma”
Reviews.Author: askmsh
Reviews.Content: We were not overly impressed with the service here with the exception of the maid staff and the young man who covered the reception desk in the evenings. The maids were were prompt, efficient, and friendly. The evening desk clerk was friendly and helpful. Great dinner reccommendations. Our room was not ready one hour after the time it was promised and there was great delay and confusion at check out (a different clerk). Our room was nice, large and clean. The bathroom was large and clean, however the shower/shower head did not work correctly. The bed was very comfortable and the "special deal" for the internet, movies, and music was a good deal. The location near the Termini was REALLY nice as was the near by Metro stop. It was not a bad walk to most of the major sites and if so, the Metro was easy and pleasant to use. Breakfast had many choices, but the dining room was crowded and hot and the coffee and juice machines did not work correctly. We might not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: newlywedjune2008
Reviews.Content: I got married in Hotel Quirinale on the 28th of june 2008. I chose it from the internet, having decided to not get a wedding planner and spent many nights trawling through internet reviews. I contacted the hotel directly and spoke to the event organizers at the hotel who I found efficient and helpful. A lot of our guests as a result stayed there. As you can imagine, not having been there before, i was a little apprehensive but my apprehension was unfounded. It was the perfect venue for an irish wedding in Italy. The hotel is beautiful, not perfect, I would say shabby chic! It is very centrally located, and the foyer was lovely. All our rooms were spacious, clean, nicely decorated with lovely marble bathrooms. We had a disabled room for my husbands parents who are quite old. No one had any complaints. Breakfast had a great choice and was delicious. The reception itself consisted of drinks and snacks in the lovely garden, which was great for the kids and a lovely 4 course meal with a fabulous wedding cake in the sala verdi which was grand! Music, I booked, was a guy who does many weddings at the hotel called Sergio and he was brilliant. He learnt our first dance and really got the crowd going. Also, the head waiter on the night of the wedding was uber professional. Overall, i could find little fault with the hotel. the accommodation, food, staff, furnishings, atmosphere and child friendliness of the place made it an absolute winner! No regrets just wonderful happy memories. PS. My only negative point is that the organizing staff have a relaxed manner, which made me worry a little, but everything that I had asked for was done and there were no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: carolineh35
Reviews.Content: we got married in rome Nov 2007 and stayed in the Quirinale Hotel with our young son and parents. The hotel was in a great location and the staff were so nice and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Lovely large bedrooms and bathrooms. I was in touch with hotel via email before our arrival and they were so helpful regarding meals and other wedding stuff. Even told me about great hairdresser around the corner from hotel where i went morning of the wedding. Hope to visit rome again and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: Retiredactive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week at the Quirinale. It's location is very central especially for bus stops, restaurants, and the opera. Our room was spacious and clean. We liked the soft comfy beds and all white comforters. Staff spoke English and were always accommodating. The garden restaurant offered good value, professional service and tasty food. Breakfasts were included. They need to buy a real bread toaster and throw away the ancient restaurant type that too many hotels use and which deliver toasted and cold toast, someone needs to learn how to make crisp bacon and hard boiled eggs would be preferable to their scrambled eggs. Real orange juice would also have been appreciated. There was only a single door separating our room and one next to ours. The sound carried all too well.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting experience”
Reviews.Author: Aburel
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated hotel with an interesting old touch. We found the room spacious, also the bathroom, but the privacy was poor due to the access door. Breakfast (available in the garden too)was fine, the coffee excellent. Location good for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value - Quirinale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzDublin9
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night at the Quirinale but could have stayed longer. It is a great hotel with a great location - 5 mins walk from Roma Termini and close enough to all the major tourist attractions (most of which are a 20 min walk away av. but the red bus tour leaves from the Termini and will take you everywhere). But the real clincher for me was the price (€155 for a twin) - such great value and it included a fantastic hot & cold buffet breakfast! The rooms are a good size and are very clean and the bathroom is a good size too. Staff are excellent too - from the reception staff who greeted us, to the accommodation staff we met on the corridors, all are very friendly and are ready with a smile and a bon giorno. This was my first trip to Rome, I will definitely go back and will stay again at the Quirinale. I would heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Drin
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception in the Hotel Quirinale in 2007. I cannot fault the organisers of oour wedding reception. All of theorganising was done through emails and we decided on the wine the day before the wedding! The hotel is grand old hotel, it has alot of charm and character. If you are looking for a new modern hotel, this is not the place for you. If you like old, charming hotels with character I would definately reccommend the Quirinale. We ahd our wedding recption out in the garden and everything was prefect, the food, the setting, the service, definately top class. The hotel is in walking distance of most of the major attractions and the tour buses depart near by. The area is very safe, as we went out walking a few nights in the early hours of the morning and never had any trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KMPNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed there once again - but unfortunately only for one night. It was a wonderful stay - the room was beautiful, the front desk personnel were terrific and helpful and the breakfast was outstanding. Only one problem - while Room 442 was absolutely beautiful, the shower leaked all over the floor - probably something that could be easily fixed. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcrick
Reviews.Content: Spent seven nights from May 17th - 24th. Word of advise, insist on a room on the courtyard side. Hotel is in a good location, but right on Nazionale, a very busy road for buses, motorcycles and cars, and the cobblestone roads didn't help. We walked everywhere from this location; 10 min to Colosseum, 10 min to Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon. Metro stop(Republica) 1 block away . Standard Room was large, bathroom large too. Lots of hot water, but narrow tub. Use of safe included with room rate. Breakfast was ok, but got boring after awhile as it never changes. Staff were quite friendly and helpful; booked Borghese museum for us, dining staff made us REAL cappuccino when asked. Main reason we booked was hubby's deal with his work, $135 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb example of Italian style”
Reviews.Author: Silverback,Surrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel got extreme reviews on Tripadvisor so I was sligjhtly concerned which I would find to be accurate. If you are expecting a modern 4 star hotel you will be disappointed. If you are expecting a stylish, traditional Italian hotel with charm and elegance, this is the place for you. I stayed with my wife and two friends and had the best three days ever. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the staff friendly and very efficient and the hotel just slightly quirky but typically Italian. Exactly as depicted on the Quirinale website. Convenient for all the main historic sites - it will take you a full three days to walk around all of the main ones. If you like food, check out the following restaurant: Il Post Accanto at via del boschetto 36a tel: [--]. Turn left out of the hotel and walk about 500 metres to the turning on the left. The restaurant is on the right. Opens at 8 and will probably only sit about 20. All food is cooked fresh in front of you - worth every penny!!! The hotel serve a good, substantial breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: azztheboss
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay, great location, walking distance to everywhere. Via Nazionale is a busy street with plenty of restaurants and bars. We stayed 3 nights total and were upgraded to a mini suite (twice the size of the regular room) the last 2 nights, which was very nice. The breakfast (included) was nice enough and kept us fed until the evening. Did not experience the garden as it was raining. We took the Leonardo express from the airport and walked 4 blocks to the hotel, very easy to find. The Coliseum is a 10 minute walk. It is an old hotel, front doors of rooms needs to be upgraded and we could hear the neighbors as if they were in our room, but it did not bother us that much. Sure there is better, but for the price, it is more than enough, clean and the service was good. Good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't like it.... too "fuddy-duddy"”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: We assumed this was a great place.... back more than 100 years ago. Nowadays, there are simply much better hotels to stay, both location and price wise. Breakfast was option short and limited (although included in the room price that was a plus), room was big enough, but with truly old fashioned forniture (other than a mini-flat screen tv). However, no classy or even clasic taste, just old!! We were hearing our neighbors breath, so no sense of intimacy at all. And the last and the worst, special chapter required: the bed: uncomfortable, with two sprung mattress together, no a real queen bed!!, so noisy and soft that once you landed over one spot, you weren't dare to move. I don't need to say what does it mean for your sleep confort. In summary, we won't recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is not 4 star, but do-able!”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadAR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. I was scared after booking to read all of the negative reviews - but my boyfriend and I found this hotel to be fine - we ate, slept and showered there... the beds were twin pushed together so we had to "make do" but it was clean and the bathroom was big. No problems with running out of hot water either. The location was great - Coluseum was 5 blocks away and Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, all walking distance. The breakfast was fine - we were able to get online with the proper device that we had to purchase...overall it wasn't a 4 star but it was neat to stay in such an "antiquey" place. Staff were helpfull also, all English speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: ThetaChi
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for 5 days over Christmas '07. There were five of us in total. My three kids stayed in a very large triple while my wife and I had what appeared to be one of the larger doubles. The room was a little dated, but we thought that was part of its old world charm. For us, the one place that the hotel really shined was on service. When we arrived, none of our luggage made it to Rome (my advise is to avoid Alitalia at all costs). The staff at the hotel was sympathetic and volunteered to call the airlines every hour for us until our luggage arrived three days later. The hotel had good food and a nice bar. It's close to the metro and on a street loaded with good restaurants, bars and gelato places. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, needs modernisation”
Reviews.Author: ocarrollm
Reviews.Content: I can understand the mixed reviews this hotel has recieved here having spent three nights here. A friend of mine had recommeded it and we booked through Hotelclub.com reserving a double room for 3 nights Thur, Fri and Sat for €408 which was reasonable. It was my second time in Rome and it's hard to say what the best location in Rome is for a hotel but suffice to say this is not it. The hotel itself is tired and our room was the smallest double room I've ever stayed in!! The TV and AC did not work properly. The bed was uncomfortable and the decor in poor repair. It claims to be a 4star and clearly it is not. In did notice that some of the rooms were bigger and brighter so upgrade if you can. They serve an excellant buffet breakfast which made up for the experience a little. Look , if you're in roRome you will want to be out and about which we were and we treated this hotel simply as a a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: vanessadc_ge
Reviews.Content: - no hot water 2 times in 2 days - 30°C in the room and no way to decrease it except to open the windows : but very noisy as it's on a main street ! - none at the bar for ordering a drink - People at the reception really not nice I think it's much to many problems for a 4 stars hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Day at Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: klostar
Reviews.Content: We got married in Quirinale on 3rd September 2007. We hadn't seen the hotel before arriving in Rome, and on our 1st visit we were delighted and relieved that it was as beautiful as other reviewers had described. The foyer, Garden, lounges are exquisite. We were upgraded to the Junior Suite for the wedding night and it was amazing. We spoke to Barbara 2 days before the wedding and she went to great lengths to make sure everything would be perfect for us on our special day - reception location, table plans, and a few extra personal touches we wanted. We had our aperetifs and champagne in the garden, followed by the reception meal under a canopy also in the garden. Everything went so smoothly. The food was delicious and the staff were super efficient, helpful and pleasant. The garden setting for the wedding was very special. Only negative - the hotel reception staff made us wait before checking us in on arrival. We were very keen to join our guests at our reception at this time. All the other hotel staff were super helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not a good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: mhweiss
Reviews.Content: I read a number of the reviews before my stay and was sprised by the range and contrast of experiences. I have travel extensively thru europe on business and expected a htoel past it's prime but otherwise clean and efficient. As mentioned by otheres, the loaction is great, about 75 yeards to the metro and 3 blocks to the main transportation terminal. An easy walk bags and only a 30 min train ride to the aiport. For the worst thing about the hotel was no internet access in the room. Those of you traveling on business will need to trrek down to the lobby to get woreless connection at 3 euros per hour. The room was small and I had an ugly view of a dank view of other building. I was to tired when I checked in to request to move to a view over the scenic courtyard. Unlike some other experiences my door firt fine -I was on the 4th floor and did not notice any large gaps on the doors on my floor. The room just barley fit the queens size bed. Thee was no room for sitting chairs or a place to relax outside of the bed. The batroom was of a normal size. The bath had a wall and hand held show head. I couldn't adjust the temp on the wall mounted one and used the hand held for my three day sty. I paid $135e for the room which was much less then the $300e I had quited for the Marriotts and Hilton so I think I got what I paid for. The breakfast was ok but nothing special. I would agree with the assesment that this is nt a 4 star hotel, closer to 2 and a half or three stars.

Reviews.Title: “An Utterly Awful Place”
Reviews.Author: ninewinx
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a magical trip to Italy. We were primarily on the Amalfi Coast but flew home from Rome. After the fabulous accommodations in Positano, Capri, and yes, Naples, you can imagine our dismay to check into this horrible place. The location and lobbies are OK but the rest is dirty and substandard! I steeled myself as we passed the filthy carpets, holes in the artwork, scuffed walls but when they opened the door to the room all hope was lost. Our room smelled like an animal had died there. They did move us but the next room was equally depressing. It was small & dank overlooking a filthy, busy street, windows that barely closed, a door with lights shining through at the top and bottom, broken air-conditioning and walls so thin that we heard everyone coming and going. The shower attachment was broken and the hairdryer didn't work. Breakfast was no better and the automatic coffee machine was the highlight. I lost my appetite watching one of the servers put his hands through the food. The frontdesk is busy so don't expect concierge service. The private driver who whisked us promptly to the airport was the only bright spot in our hotel interactions. More than $300 a night gets you so much more than this in the US. If you want the best Italy has to offer go to the VILLA BRUNELLA in Capri. AMAZINGLY SPECIAL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: nickymLondon
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel over the august bank holiday. After reading several of the reviews beforehand we were a bit skepical about what we might find! It is true the hotel is old fashioned in alot of ways but I like this aspect as a futuristic hotel in Rome just isnt right. Location is very good, walking distance to Termini station therefore a good place to get buses all over town. The hotel reception staff and porter were very helpful and answered all of our questions, RE opening times of the musuems, dress code of the vatican, buses to different places etc etc. The room (we had a superior) was great, very big and spacious. All mod cons but kept the charm of the hotel too, particuarly loved the chandalier! Air con was fine, we went when Rome had a heatwave and was 40degrees so air con was very important to us. Nice and cool all the time although for some strange reason it made a sound like a small boy banging on his bongos all throughout the night!!! I kid you not, has anyone else experienced this? Breakfast was good although wouldnt let us sit out in the garden area because of a wedding i believe but still sat outside which was lovely. Breakfast is fine and adequate for the day. Overall we both liked this hotel and would reccomend it to other people. Rome is a must see city, lived up to all my expectations and beyond. p.s top tip - get your colessuem tickets from the Palatine as hardly any queue.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Crappy Airconditioning, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: virtualcowboy
Reviews.Content: What a complete and utter dissapointment. Other then a great location (which it really is) and a really neat little pizza place across the street (good and cheap) the hotel sucked. It was cooler outside at night then after 72 hours of the air running continuosly in our room. The staff was unconcerned and lied to us about sending someone to check it even after three days of complaining. The only reason we didnt leave was because this was part of a package. Do yourself a favor and DONT stay here. The hotel was probably beautiful in it's prime (which according to a sign outside was in 1870 I think.) But it seriously needs renovation. There are TONS of hotels on the same street. ROME is awsome and even this terrible experience didn't ruin our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RedGentlemen
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a superb central location right next to the republicca metro line which links easily to the spanish steps and the vatican city. The bus station in front of the hotel links also to the old part of rome (not accesible from the metro) well with late night buses running that are safe and cheap. The hotel is also situated closely to the main train station 'Termini' which is only a 5 minute walk away (or get the bus 64). The bar across the road called the 'George Byron' is friendly and (compared to everywhere else in Rome) fairly well priced. The rooms were clean and spacious and offered views of the Via Nazionale. The only negative re the rooms was that two single beds were pushed together to make a double bed - not ideal for couples!!! The staff were abrupt but efficient and professional (this is what I actual prefer). The american breakfast was splendid and was a really enjoyable part of the day as it was served in the hotel gardens which are very peaceful and relaxing. If you are going to Rome then this is an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Sparkling Wedding at the Quirinale!!”
Reviews.Author: boratakin
Reviews.Content: We spent one week in the Quirinale for our Wedding. Perfect from start to finish!! Barbara and the Banqueting Staff were so attentive and professional. All the food and drink was classy and plentiful. We had a unique and perfect experience. Best day of our lives!! Many of our 60 guests stayed with us - all were delighted with their rooms. We loved the chique antique style of the Hotel. It was truly magnificent Roman Holiday! Hats off to the Quirinale!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby chic.”
Reviews.Author: FandK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quirinale hotel for 3 night in July. It is located at the Termini end of Via Nazionale, so if your luggage isn't too heavy, it's about a 10min walk. The hotel was probably very grand one time, there are traces of its heyday all around. However, it is a little treadbare now and grubby too. The walls could seriously do with a good wash down. Our room was overlooking other rooms and the kitchen, not very nice, however it was wonderfully quite. The rooms itsself was large, had good wardrobe space and high ceilings. The staff were professional if a little cold and distant. We ate there one evening and it was excellent, we have a lovely table over looking the garden courtyard. It's a good place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Summer62
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Quirinale last week- a very good experience. The location is excellent; the staff is helpful; and the hot American breakfast, with great variety, was the best I encountered in our travels. The furnishings in the guest rooms are somewhat spartan, and showing their age a bit, but the rooms are spotlessly clean, and the whole establishment has a pleasant patina of history. Worth mentioning is lobby internet access (for 3 euros/hour). My only complaints arise from the fact that it was a little hard to control the water temperature in the shower, and my mattress was a back-breaker. However, for convenience, cleanliness, and pleasant atmosphere- not to mention that fabulous breakfast!- the Quirinale would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “An above-average, but not great, hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cassiebelle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Quirinale is pretty well-located, just a few minutes' walk from the Spanish Steps and the Piazza della Repubblica. The staff was generally knowledgeable, and the room and bathroom were clean. However, the room doors are very old-fashioned, and have a large gap between the top of the door and the frame. Thus, we had a beam of light coming into the room at all hours. Plus, the thin walls allowed us to hear people trudging down the hall constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Misst1984
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Good location Spacious lobby and bar area clean rooms Historical Cons: Some rooms are very small Rooms need upgrading Walls were too thin, could hear your neighbor next store. Staff was not the most helpful There are much nicer hotels in a Rome for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Functional 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Bobs-big-vacation
Reviews.Content: In July 2007, this was a busy hotel catering to the independent traveller and coach party alike. Reception was hectic at times and explains some reviewers comments that staff were unhelpful...personally, I felt this was understandable given the busy pace of the lobby. However, the staff acknowledged attempts to speak Italian by immediately speaking in English...so when your Italian is poor how can that be unhelpful? The communal areas, breakfast room, and garden have a "yesterdays charm" seen in many an Italian hotel that modernists would describe as dated but it is charming nevertheless. Check out what photo's you can, the reality of the decor is what you see in the pictures. The same decor greets you in the bedroom. Bedrooms are basic, clean, high ceilinged, large and airy. We were pleased to have avoided the bed of a previous review with the greasy headboard, but found instead a (higher than usual) hardwood antique that was it must be said, very comfortable. Air conditioning was noisy, but welcome, given that it was 29 degrees outside. Bathroom was very large and clean but in keeping with the traditional decor, unfortunately did NOT have a modern power shower. Street noise was noticeable even though we faced a side street. Breakfast was typically continental and the hot buffet was limited and fairly uninviting...decent coffee and juice though even if it was out of a machine! Location...you have a manageable walk to any of the sights but after a long day (and night) of walking, the hotel is situated at the top end of Via Nazionale and there are undoubtedly better loacted hotels. That said, it is on the doorstep of the Termini and is well placed for access to the airport trains or nearby metro. Many of the reviews of the Quirinale that we have read seem to either hate it or love it, but it is neither fantastically special or poor, simply functional. To that end, you get what you pay for and what it says on the tin!

Reviews.Title: “adequate but not elegant”
Reviews.Author: verytiredtraveler
Reviews.Content: we arrived at 8:30am on sunday morning, after a 14 hours airline excursion and had to wait till 2:00 before we could check in. we slept in the lobby, and waited till check in time. the room number was 136, the room didnt look anything like the photos on the website, we had two twin bed pushed together instead of a king size bed. the ac was inadequate, and the one window in the room on the first floor faced an alley, whereby we could observe the rubbish being put out every morning. i was very dissappointed. The buffet breakfast in the garden included in the package was the only good thing about the hotel. The lobby and parlor was elegant, but the room we stayed in was not anything to write home about. the shower was too small, and drain was clogged with hair. we would not stay at the quirinale again. When we checked out, our bill was .60 cents for three local phone calls, we didnt eat or use any of the hotel ammenaties that we would have to pay for. It was close to the train station which we used a lot, we went to florence, assisi, and many other towns were available from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, rooms need upgrade”
Reviews.Author: TCP-GDI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights since we were attending a wedding being held in the hotel. The lobby is very nice, as is the dining hall and courtyard. Once you get away from this area, the hotel begins to look dated. The carpets on the stairwells and halls are worn, some floor tiles broken, ceiling tiles missing. We had a room in a corner of the hotel, and could hear the people talking in the room next to us (or should I say heard the kids screaming). Our floors were wood, and was broken in several places. The place was OK for a clean place to lay our heads, but not much more than that. We thought it was a good location, but not particularly good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy beds and a clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyEngland
Reviews.Content: having read some reviews we were pleasantly surprised by the Quirinale. It's true that the staff don't seem interested and don't go out of their way to be welcoming. (that could be said of many Italians we came into contact with) However, location and cleanliness are more important and this hotel ticked those boxes. We were in a room overlooking the garden and it was very quiet with the shutters closed, I imagine if we had been overlooking the road at the front it would be noisier. We timed ourselves walking to the termini, it took 12 minutes at a comfortable pace. The breakfast is also important as it sets you up for the busy day ahead, contrary to other reviews, we were impressed with the choice, cereal,fruit, pastries or a good old cooked breakfast. We went to breakfast early (7.30) and later (9.30) each time the choice was plentiful and hot. We did the green line bus tour as it was a good way to get your bearings and you can get on and off at will.The full tour lasts approx 2 hours, you get given headphones with a selection of languages, a narrative explains the story behind the history as the bus passed by a particular venue. At the Colesseum, there are no information signs, we were approached and asked if we wanted to join a tour. It lasted approx 1 hour and we were given a leaflet about other tours that Romatours offered. We went on their Vatican tour the next day, it was well worth paying the extra just to walk past the people who'd been queueing for hours in the blazing hot sunshine. Our tour guide, Amanda, was enthusiastic and made it very interesting. We walked from the hotel to the Trevi Fountain, which was beautiful lit up in the evening, and threw in the required coins! This area had plenty of choice for restaurants and competitively priced, on average we paid 50 euros for a 2 course meal and wine for 2 adults which included a tip. We also experienced the metro, it's not unlike the tube in London, but they decide to close lines when there is no obvious alternative route. Most places you would want to see can be reached on foot, (comfortable shoes a neccessity) though having a good map is essential as the information signs aren't the best! All in all, we made the most of a 3 day break and enjoyed every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Common courtesy”
Reviews.Author: Captain006
Reviews.Content: One expects a certain level of courtesy when staying at a 4* Hotel. I have to say that the staff were almost without exception morose, almost as if they did not want to be there. I mentioned a problem on the first morning which was still not attended to when I left. The Hotel was clean and generally catered for our needs but again when I asked them to book a taxi to take us to the Airport I was offerred the Hotel bus for 68 euros, we booked a taxi for a fixed price of 30 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KMEMP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in mid A pril. After reading some of the reviews on this sight, I was a bit fearful. However, I must say that we were very, very pleased. From check in to check out the staff was outstanding. The included breakfast was very extensive - lots of choices - something for everyone. The decor was fun - it seemed to be a typical older Roman hotel - just the experience we wanted from a hotel - it wasn't sterile and flavorless like a "Marriott", for example. The bar/sitting area was beautiful and so well kept. The housekeeping staff was outstanding - sheets and fluffy towels were changed every day. Only one problem, not within walking distance to the center of Rome, although taxis were plentiful and not that expensive. I would stay there again. KMP

Reviews.Title: “lovely central hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: frannyann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the end of april and thoroughly enjoyed it! The character of the hotel is beautiful and the decor matches the feeling of rome! As people have mentioned you do have slight traffic noise but that didn't bother us at all as its part of the hustle and bustle of rome! The hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance to the sights and shops! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BubblesIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel recently. Really friendly staff and the rooms were nice. The room lacked mirrors, no iron in room, you would have to get your clothes ironed by the hotels laundry service dept and i thought in this day and age irons were standard in hotel rooms.We had a room to the front and the traffic was abit noisy to be honest. Huge selection at breakfast but the staff wouldn't give you a chance to finish your breakfast in piece, always buzzing around you. Overall a lovely hotel and we had a nice stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on short notice”
Reviews.Author: 1SGTommy
Reviews.Content: We made late reservations at the Quirinale because we wanted to upgrade our accommodations for our last few nights in Italy. The Quirinale is conveniently located near the Roma Termini train station and a lot of other attractions like the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain to the north and the Roman Forum and many churches to the west. The room was huge and the bathroom nice. We were in a street front room so it was noisy, but honestly, that's part of the charm of going to Italy. We asked for a

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue for wedidngs”
Reviews.Author: Catherineinireland
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception in the Quirinale on the 31st of October and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The 65 guests from Ireland and different parts of Europe and America were delighted with the surroundings. We had the most amazing wedding meal inside the hotel after enjoying appertifes in the gardens. The honeymoon suite was out of this world and whenever you needed something done or a question answered, the staff were professional, efficent and helpful. Barbara who organises the weddings was an angel.

Reviews.Title: “No sparkle....must try harder!”
Reviews.Author: RR80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Quirinale for the first 3 nights of our Honeymoon. Whilst we LOVED Rome, we wished we had tried a different hotel. It's not that there is anything wrong as such; clean, large rooms, good location....we just didn't feel like we were made very welcome. Check in was abrupt and not at all welcoming...not what you want when you have just arrived!! Breakfast was ok, just not a great selection and nothing seemed that fresh...the eggs were like they had been sitting there for hours. Coffee from a vending machine....Yummy. The setting was very pretty though. The hotel looks grand but lacks the character and charm found in many Italian hotels. Not one member of staff stood out or went out of their way to help, in fact we felt like we were an inconvenience. Would not stay here again, especially when there are so many other hotels in such an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but...........”
Reviews.Author: COMB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights from Oct. 4th. The location is great - very central and a 10 minute walk from Roma Termini station. It is an old hotel with some quirks e.g. all the room doors open outwards! Our room was large, with the biggest bathroom we've ever seen. We had requested a double/queen bed but got two twins, which had to be pushed together - not too comfortable. The front desk staff while appearing helpful did not actually deliver on a couple of occasions. The breakfast was very good and the breakfast room was excellent, overlooking an interior courtyard. This hotel is trying hard to live up to its rating, but not quite making it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Scoobey
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, perhaps not what you would expect from a 4* in the UK, but good location for shopping, sight seeing and to the more livelier areas of the city. On the whole though the hotel was clean and plenty of space. Bedroom and en-suite bathroom were a good size and clean. Staff were helpful but not overly friendly. The restaurant where breakfast was served was a good size, and we didn't have any problems finding a seat. When it looked like all the tables had been taken, the staff just set up some extra ones. Plenty of food for breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Great Location....Great Price”
Reviews.Author: MelFROG
Reviews.Content: My family traveled in Rome September 5th - 10th. Hotel Quirinale is not a by any means a five star hotel, but for the money the hotel is great. Very close to the Roman Forum, Colloseum, Fountain de Trevi, and great shopping. The hotel staff was polite and helpful. Everynight we would have drinks on their terrace/courtyard, with lovely music (by a keyboard) playing in the background. The staff even made accomidations for my birthday as my husband requested champagne and strawberrys to our room. The rooms were quaint, and clean. I would defeninately look into staying Hotel Quirinale.

Reviews.Title: “Well past its best and poor service”
Reviews.Author: slim_nano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in August. The public rooms look good which makes you think that the bedrooms will be also - but they aren't! Our room was very basic - it felt more 2 star than 4 star. The worst thing being the extremely soft matresses. The breakfast was very poor - stale cereal and croissants. The service wasn't good, the only friendly staff we saw in the whole place were the cleaners. The porter made a sarcastic remark to our taxi driver when I only tipped him 2 euros for putting our luggage in the boot of the taxi - I didn't think that was bad for 5 seconds work! If you are staying here beware of the hotels limousine service to the airport. We were given the hard sell on this service - only 55 euros being the same price as the taxis! I knew differently having asked the taxi driver the night before. we politely declined and took a taxi which cost only 22 euros. It was very disappointing that the hotel were trying to get us to spend 33 euros more than we needed to. I will definitely not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quarinale room sucks...Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: knjai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Quarinale for one night...the hotel has a good looby and hallways ... but the room sucks big time.The bed was rock hard and had a mesh around it....the bathrooms and the tub were not clean....all this for a 4 star hotel with a steep price...we paid 145 Euros for this dump...!! The location was Ok...It was commutable by train and bus...there were were not a whole lot of restaurant which you could find nearby. I do not recommend this hotel ...try the sheraton which is so much better and it provides a shuttle to the downtown...you are probably getting better value there with a heavenly bed...where you can get some nice sleep instead of sleeping on a rock.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: alanceltic
Reviews.Content: Held my Wedding recpetion in this hotel and they made a complete mess of it. They had one manager and one waitress on duty, ALL of the courses were terrible and for the main course...get this, the waitress was left to serve on her own, the food was terrible and STONE COLD, I had enough and went to find the manager to complain and was amazed to find him cleaning a table in the hotels restaraunt. I was told the situation would be rectified immediately and it was....the food was brought back into the kitchen to be MICROWAVED, I was offered all sorts of lame excuses and if the matter wasnt so serious i would have wet myself laughing. I contacted the hotel manger by emai 2 weeks later and it came as no great surprise that I was offered another bunch of lame excuses, I did get an apology but it was served with a hugh portion of lies, excuses and more lies. We checked out this hotel on a trip before the wedding and whilst the lobby and restaraunt areas are very nice the rooms are a throw back to the 60's (thats the 1860's folks) some people might interpret this as character I like to call it old and smelly. I have a lot of time for people who work in hotels as it is a tough job but this place makes faulty towers look like The Ritz. Expect an outdated hotel with an outdated opinion on how the customer doesnt really matter so long as we fill rooms based on our redicilously inappropriate 4stars....agree with previous posts that they would be hard pressed to maintain 2stars even based on italys dodgy grading system....avoid like the plague

Reviews.Title: “lobby area beautiful. The lower room floors--not so much.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelandreview
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in the US and in Europe and this hotel was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I stayed with a large group of 70 and after visiting many of their rooms to "compare" I have found that the nice rooms are in different areas of the hotel. Generally, if you get a room on the top floor your room is better. Also, certain "wings/halls" of each floor are better. Each room I visited looked completly different than the other. Top floor rooms were huge and nice, while on other floors I could barely fit between the wall and the bed (luggage couldn't fit unless you turned it sideways). Regardless of what floor you stay on or room size, one SHOULD have clean bedcovers, blankets, walls, and drapes. I'm not saying it should look new, but when you can stand 10 feet away and see the stains, there is a problem. (if you took a blanket and rolled around in the mud with it--that is what it looked like). Walking down the hallways they were dirty and literally had who knows what growing on the walls. Spider webs were everywhere. The bathrooms were nice in my room, but other rooms I visited they were completly different (in a bad way). I have stayed in other hotels in Rome, Florance, Paris, and Germany that were of the same 'class' and they were NOTHING like this horrible hotel. This hotel should be rated 2.5 stars, upgraded, and cleaned ASAP. I have stayed in dirty hotels in the past that were literally $25 a night and they were cleaner than this.

Reviews.Title: “Our Wedding was out of this world”
Reviews.Author: glenealy
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding in Hotel Quirinale on Monday May 1st 2006. We and our 48 guests stayed at the hotel. The staff were fantastic, the rooms were great - our suite was exquisite, the food at the wedding was exceptional. We had aperitifs amd spent most of the afternoon in the beautifull secluded garden sipping prosecco during the speeches. All I can say in a nutshell is that I hope we spend many a happy anniversary there because it is a wonderful hotel. THE only thing I would say is the rooms do seem to differ, my god parents asked to change their room as it was very small but if you have a problem say so and they will sort it no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Romagnome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quirinale with a large group in May. I, too, was concerned about staying here after reading some of the negative reviews on other sites. Coming in with low expectations, I was very pleasantly surprised by the loveliness of the hotel. Very elegant in an old-fashioned way. Our room was large and overlooked the side street Via Torino. The windows were wonderfully sound-proofed against the noise of the Via Nazionale. Our bathroom was huge and completly tiled in marble, with a large tub with stand up shower (along with a hand-held shower, as well) and bidet. I think the rooms vary quite a bit at this hotel, so if you aren't pleased with your room, ask to see another. Also, you couldn't ask for a better location. We walked everywhere (on this side of the Tiber).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: BrianMoroney
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our Daughter's Wedding reception which was held in the Quirinale Hotel. Elena (Quirinale wedding co-ordinator) and her team laid on a first class reception which, from start to finish, was simply fantastic. From the moment the newly weds arrived from St.Sylvesters church it was 5 star treatment all the way. The drinks reception was held in the oasis of the gardens and then the main meal itself was served in a room that had been carefully and sumptously decorated for our small party of 48. The wine and champagne flowed, the food was superb, the staff happy and efficient, the wedding cake brilliant, in fact everything we asked of Elena was delivered and much much more. I would strongly recommend any couple thinking of celebrating their marriage in Rome to head for the Quirinale for their reception. You would be hard pushed to do better than their complete package. By the way, ask Elena any question relating to your reception and she will make every effort to give you a prompt, speedy and very helpful response. Delighted Parents of the bride.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding in the Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband and 33 of our family and friends travelled to the Quirinale in March were we had our wedding reception in the Quirinale. We can honestly say it was the best time of our lives. The hotel is fantastic, old fashioned but elegant. Our suite was situated on the 4th floor and our room WOW!!! The wedding day couldnt have been better. We got married in the Bascilica di San Silvestro. What a magnificent church. And the priest who married us was from Tipperary! Who couldnt have been nicer. After our ceremony we hired a coach to take us all around the famous sites of Rome where we got beautiful photos. The tour itself was a great idea and worked out really well. When we returned back to the Quirinale we sat in the beautiful gardens were we had canapes and the wine and champagne flowed all day. We then returned into the foye were we had our meal which couldnt have been nicer. The food I have to say was the best we tasted during our stay in Rome. And the wine kept flowing!!!! After our meal we went into the lobby were there is a piano and the piano player was playing all night we danced and had a great laugh until about 12am, as all music in the hotel has to stop at that time. Our wedding co ordinator, which we found ourselves through their website was the nicest person we have ever met, she helped us for months previous planning and hiring everything from start to finish. Her name was Elena and I have to praise her for her patience with us as we were very nervous leading up to our day asking so many questions!!!! All in all it was the best trip of our lives we flew onto the Maldives for our honeymoon and to be honest we were very upset leaving Rome and the hotel. If you are planning to have your wedding abroad we would highly recommend contacting this hotel their is nothing they would not help you with from the flowers to car hire from makeup and hairdressers to photography for the day. If you have any questions regarding planning your wedding abroad please do not hesitate in emailing with any queries.

Reviews.Title: “Quirinale was okay, location a little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne202
Reviews.Content: Based on the mixed reviews for the Quirinale, it appears the room quality can vary greatly depending on how the reservation is made. We stayed as part of an independent package tour, and we chose an upgrade in hotel to the Quirinale. As a result, our peaceful, oversized room was in the back of the building, away from the street, with a large sitting area (sofa, coffee table, two chairs), a huge bathroom with double sink, whirlpool tub with shower, and bidet. Bed was king size (two twins pushed together). Decoration was Imperial style, quite formal, with lots of gilt and red satin upholstery. Room was very clean, with clean sheets and fresh towels each day. Air conditioning hadn't been turned on for the summer, so late each afternoon the room was at least 80 degrees, even with the window open. It cooled off at night, so we were fine. The included breakfast buffet was plentiful and offered lots of choices. In-room internet service was 8 euros an hour, while the internet point down a side street on the next block (5 minute walk) was only 1.50 euros for 30 minutes, a no-brainer for checking e-mail. Hotel staff were always pleasant and accommodating. There aren't a lot of budget restaurants in the immediate area, but about a 3-minute walk brings you to Target, with a full menu and decent pizza (as noted by Rick Steves in his Rome guide). We also tried the Irish pub a block from the hotel. It was good and open late, always very noisy, and quite busy at dinner time. Dagnini, a restaurant/bakery in a mini-mall about 2 blocks away, was good, inexpensive, and convenient, and Ristorante da Giovanni about 6 blocks away (10 minutes' walk) was excellent for a real homestyle Italian meal. The Quirinale is a good choice for reasonable accommodation near the train station, but it's at least a mile walk to Rome's most famous tourist destinations. It takes about 20 minutes to walk down the Via Nazionale. From there you'd branch off to get to the Trevi Fountain, the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trastevere, the Vatican, etc. In future I'd want to stay closer to those neighborhoods to cut down on extra walking and to have more evening dinner options. The hotel offered a car service to the airport for 68 euro, a steep price, but we decided on that because we needed a 5:15 a.m. pickup. A regular taxi would probably have been substantially cheaper for the same trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.”
Reviews.Author: deenaclaire
Reviews.Content: Location is good, not great. One can walk or take a bus to most places of interest, and the neighborhood is safe. We ate breakfast at the Quirinale, which was edible but not exciting, but went out for other meals. No problem with the room, which was on the 5th floor, except for a mysterious water leak in the bathroom which just pooled a bit in the middle of the floor. We never found the source of this little leak. But the room was clean, spacious, w/ modern appointments, including a safe in the closet for guest use. In a city of pickpockets, we found that useful. I would not recommend a room facing the street; traffic can be VERY noisy at night with the window open even a little bit. Lobby was very spacious, and the staff was extremely accommodating to any request. Their fee for internet usage was high; better value about a block away on one of the side streets.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely centrally located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying three nights at Hotel Quirinale and we both had a wonderful stay! We stayed on the 4th floor in a lovely spacious and grand room with our own chandelier! The bathroom was a reasonable size and the whole hotel was spotlessly clean. The hotel staff on reception were extremely helpful, friendly and polite. The continental breakfast was also very tasty and plenty of choice. Having read some of the previous negative reviews about this hotel I was also dubious about what to expect. However, upon arrival I was very pleased with everything that I saw and would consider this hotel to be of high quality with excellent customer service. I would certainly have no problems with staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmina
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel after checking out of a dissapointing hotel,the walk in rate was great 135 euro.the room was like a suite,the staff helpfull and the building had character.in via nationale so close to the tourist attractions.great brakfast also.would highly recommend hotel quirinale.

Reviews.Title: “great value and do not be put off by some of the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If I had read the reviews before I booked I would not have done so -but I would have been very wrong. My wife and I had a lovely room on the 4th floor and we thoroughly enjoyed our weekend stay. The front desk staff were very corteous and made excellent recommendations regarding nearby restaurants. Excellent value for money in a conveniently located hotel

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Character Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WirralLiverpool_UK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights the room we had on the 5th floor was very big and the bathroom quite large, the shower in the bath must be the smallest trickle of water I have seen in a shower. The "American breakfast" buffet I could say I have had a lot worse why oh why do european hotels insist on making scrambled eggs as a watery mush? the bacon looks as though it has been boiled and the sausage well its just frankfurters other than that there was plenty to eat and very nice as well. I found the staff very helpfull and accomodating nothing was too much trouble for either reception or restraunt staff I think they have all been there many many years! The style of the hotel is very old fashioned and traditional and I think some of the antique furniture is worth more than the hotel itself although a number of areas could do with a lick of paint it oozes character and is definetly not a chrome & glass modern box, on the whole other than the eggs we really enjoyed it and I would reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rudy5544
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quirinale over Thanksgiving and were truly dissappointed with our hotel stay. The staff was pleasant, and the main looby areas are nice, but the actual room was terrible. I can't believe they actually call this a room. Our room shared a vent with the room the next door which not only can you hear sounds, but light and smoke also come through. The beds if you can call them that were actually worse than sleeping on the floor. The bathroom was incredibly small, and the toilet worked 1 out of 10 attempts. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone unless they do a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Quirinale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Quirinale Hotel in Rome for 5 days during the Thanksgiving Holiday this year 2005. The location was perfect. We like older, nostalic places and you will find this hotel offers that. High ceilings and parque flooring. The room was large and spacious with a little seating area. At night the bathroom area was a little on the cold side. Be prepared for that if you're going in the winter. The front desk staff was most helpful and pleasant. They recommended a private car service to take us around Rome and we were most pleased with our english speaking driver. The food in the hotel was very tasty and delightful, especially the daily breakfast. We had a room facing the main street that was a little noisy at night, but for us it added to the charm and excitement of being in Rome. As we toured other areas we decided this hotel turned out to be in one of the best locations in Rome for us. Bring comfortable walking shoes and get out and explore all of the wonderful little back streets around the hotel. We are returning again next year and will be booking this hotel. I highly recommend this spot.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never written a hotel review before but i felt i needed to give the Quirinale the credit it deserved after the bad reviews that i had read. We stayed there for 4 nights this month and from our experience would have no problem in recommending it. It is not your typical American style hotel but it is a hotel with real character, great lobby area and the garden area is really nice. Our standard double room was quite large with a big bathroom, really clean and very comfortable bed. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of the sights and a safe area. There may be other rooms that are not as nice as the one we were in but from what we saw during our stay, we would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Italy this past summer with my niece. We had wonderful accomodations throughout our trip until we arrived at this hotel. Having been to Rome before and stayed at a 4 star hotel I was quite surprised that this hotel was rated the same. I would have given it one star at most. I am only writing this at this point because I decided to check the reviews while on this site. My impression of this hotel is similar to others that have written also. After checking in we were take to our room which as I recall was on the 2nd floor. We immediately noticed that the beds were camp cots (NOT KIDDING). A single thin foam matress on a wire mesh base! The window sill met up with a flat tar roof where workers had been working and dumped all their trash into the window sill of this room. We asked to be moved to another room with real beds. We ended up somewhere near the basement...close to the cage lift. This room had 2 small double matresses and nothing else except a chair which had stains all over the seat...there was about 1 foot of space around the bed. The walls were covered in filth. Stains of various colors including something brown dripping down the ceiling from the room above. The window was some odd type of door with no lock on it to the outside. We went back to the reception area and spoke to the manager. They were able to move us to another room which was slightly cleaner then the last. We placed a call to our travel agent and placed a complaint against this hotel and asked to be moved to another hotel. We were unable to move to another hotel as we had already paid and we would not be reimbursed, we were on a tight budget and could not afford to cover the cost of another hotel for 4 days. The reception staff was rude and could have cared less about our concerns. The breakfast buffet was fair at best. While the entrance to the hotel lobby is pretty...the rooms that sit above are a different story. This hotel is also in a poor location for sightseeing. Somewhat of a seedy area and really too far to walk to most of the sights. Close to the train station but that is it. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Quirinale a couple of weeks ago. I must say I was very dissappointed with the hotel We were given a tiny room, the bathroom was so small, there was no room to put any of our stuff, just a sink and thats it. There was no shelf in the shower to put shampoo etc. The air conditioning wasn't working either. The guys in reception I found to be quite rude. I would rate this as a three star hotel. The room was expensive, next time I would stay in a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned...Do not stay at the Hotel Quirinal Rome”
Reviews.Author: honk
Reviews.Content: I am not a person to ever write about a personal bad experience but this is one that I felt I must warn others about. First let me stay, Do Not Stay at the Hotel Quirinal in Rome. My family (4 adults and 2 children) spent 17 nights in Italy this past Summer. We started the trip with 1 week at a wonderful VRBO apartment in Rome then drove to just south of Florence for another wonderful 9 nights at the "Poggio ai Merli" villa while visiting all of Tuscany. It was the last night in Rome that had to be the worst experience any of us have ever had in all our years of traveling. On August 27th, 2005 we left Florence and arrived at the Hotel Quirinal about 11:00am. Hoping to enjoy our last day and night in Rome we ask to check in early. We didn't expect to be able to go to the rooms but just wanted to get the paper work done and get the keys for a later arrival. We were turned down but were allowed to put our luggage in their check room. We were okay with this since we understood that different hotels have different procedures. We left and had lunch and drove around visiting a few sites. When we returned a little after 2:00pm, the lobby was packed. We gladly waited our turn and when we finally were waited on, we were told that the 2 triple rooms we had reserved were not next to each other as we had requested but they were not even on the same floor. This was a problem since we had our 2 children. We tried to get a quad room and a double or just anything else to work out the problem. They had no other rooms. We nicely asked to cancel our reservations since they could not satisfy our needs and they refused. They said we would have to pay for the night anyway. This was just the start to the rude and nasty treatment we experienced from the staff. We decided to stay since it was only one night and they already had our credit card info. On the way to the rooms the two bell men fought with each other about who was taking us to our rooms. When we arrived at our rooms we could not believe how hot and mildew stinky they were. The rooms which were suppose to be triple, but were simply small double bedded rooms with cots pushed against the wall. Not only had we been forced to stay in the filthy, smelly rooms separated by many floors but the air conditioning didn't put out any air cooler than that of a small fan and we are accustomed to the air conditioning in Europe. The biggest complaint is this: I made our reservations 3 months in advance, requesting 2 adjoining triple rooms. I truly thought I had done my homework by checking out all the hotel review sites and most reviews with the exceptions of a very few were positive. The pictures of the rooms and the statements of this old hotel being newly refurbished were simply not true. I even asked the attendant at the desk while leaving, where were the rooms shown on the websites advertising the hotel because the two we had were nothing like this one and according to the advertisment pages the rooms at this hotel were all (all suite) rooms. This hotel is advertised as a 4 Star Hotel and I must say it should not qualify for any stars. Be warned, unless you want to stay in a filthy, stinky, Hot, misrepresented hotel with extremely rude and uncaring attendants, do not stay at the Hotel Quirinal. The good news: Our family has already booked this coming summer's holiday to travel for 3 weeks back to Italy and France and of course we will not be staying at the Hotel Quirinal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bolognababe
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding in the Quirinale in September 2005. If you are thinking of staying here - don't think, just book. The staff were incredibly friendly and professional. There is probably nothing that they can't arrange for you if you ask. The food was exceptional, served with minimal fuss. How you can serve the quality of sea bass to a large number the way they did, I will never know! The private gardens leave you with the experience that you are the only person to have ever had a reception there. The rooms were elegant, spacious and quiet. One of my highlights was the breakfast. With the option of relaxing on their garden terrace with truly wonderful coffee and a choice from their buffet, it's a place you should try out even for one night. Its very conveniently located near to the historical centre and Termini. The best value for money in terms of quality I have ever encountered. Hats off to all concerned!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinions.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked myself and my sister into the Hotel Quirinale via Expedia after having read the fantastic reviews on this website. I was very impressed with the praise it had received as well as, to be honest, the cheap upgrade on offer! I was, however, somewhat disappointed. Our first impression was excellent, it is an extremely well positioned Hotel and the Lobby and Ground floor areas are all beautiful and well maintained. Our room however was another story. The room wasn't a bad size although there wasn't a seating area as other people have mentioned... there were twin beds and that was it. The beds themselves were also extremely rickety... not too dissimilar to camp beds. The window was also 5 foot up from the floor and looked out onto a window ledge level concrete 'garden'. At only 5'3'' myself, I struggled to open and close the windows and shutters and had to stand on a chair to do so. Unhappy with the room I spoke to the manager who assured me that this was an upgraded room due to the 'garden view' and that there was nothing else available. He sounded most put out that I would even be querying the status of the room and left me feeling extremely embarrassed for even having broached the subject. It is also worth noting that as per lots of Hotels the bar prices are extremely high. A tomato juice cost 8 euros and 9 if you wanted a dash of Worcester sauce in it! There are plenty of restaurants and bars close by though that offer reasonably good value for money so it was no hardship to eat and drink out. All in all the Hotel was a disappointment although I get the impression from the variety of the reviews that we were perhaps just unlucky. I wouldn't want to write it off completely but I would make sure that on your arrival you ask to see a selection of rooms and don't settle for just anything.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I read the last review posted here about this hotel I related to everything that was said. I travel a lot around Europe and the US and stay generally in 4 star accomodation. This hotel in my opinion is the worst place I have ever stayed in. I do not normally comment on accomodation but I feel so stongly about my poor experience with this hotel that I have just had to advise others to stay away from this place. I origionally booked this hotel due to it's location which is close to the Train station, the web-site for this place really makes it look much better then it really is. The place is very old and has not seen a lick of paint in many years, (propably since when the Colleseum was in full swing with Gladiators) the carpets are dusty (be careful if you have asthma). I was shown to my room which was very, very, small, the furnishing was very basic and there was a large stain on the bed. When I complained to the hotel staff they said that could not move me as the hotel was full. I checked in early that day and other people had not yet booked in yet and they gave me some rubbish about rooms being allocated in advance. I asked the girl in reception why she had put me in the worst room in the hotel, her response was comical - 'Sir that is not our worst room'. I shudder to think what the worst room is like. I stayed 1 night in this dingy, dirty room and I manged to escape the next morning. I moved to a different hotel up the road which was an absulute delight

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Quirinale”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Quirinale and, in a nutshell, "Absolutely Perfect" is what best sums up the whole stay. A honeymoon experience by all accounts. Lovely, spacious room, good facilities, very helpful and polite staff as well as an ideal location for discovering all of Rome, on foot or otherwise. I have stayed here a couple of times before but this one has been by far the best visit to the Quirinale. We shall definitely return and I have no difficulty whatsoever in recommending it to all and sundry.

Reviews.Title: “Our apartment in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: daahling
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have recently returned from spending 4 nights at the Quirinale and it was just perfect. Apart from its great central location, the Quirinale is smart and the staff courteous and efficient. We were given a large and spacious suite on the 5th floor.. which had its own dressing room too. The bathroom was also spacious and spotless. The inroom safe was also convenient. Breakfast, which we always ate al fresco in their picturesque courtyard, was very good and had a varied selection of both hot and cold options. Would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.........I think not, awful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from holidays in Italy and I have to say I could not wait to write a review of this hotel............all I can say if anyone is intending staying here I would most certainly reconsider. I booked direct with this hotel four months in advance of staying at the hotel. I had a confirmation email from the hotel of one large double room. This is something we most certainly did not get. We got an extremely small two single room, the beds were so small a child would fall out. The bathroom itself had rust all over the bath, shower and sink and stains on the bed clothes. The hotel itself is in bad need of renovation as I'd say it has not been done up since the 60's. I would imagine years ago this hotel may have had a good reputation but it is certainly not the same now. I know a lot of Irish have wedding receptions at this hotel but again I'm sorry but I think this hotel is very poor and would be embarrassed to have my guests staying in the accomodation. As we were staying four nights at the hotel we certainly would have had no comfort staying in the room - the reception desk could not accomodate us to a different room as they said it was "booked up" even though we had checked in early before 2 O'Clock that day. The staff were rude and we were very dissappointed, we ended up leaving the hotel and booking in to another hotel which was far superior and put the Quirinale to shame. I never really write reviews after bad experiences in hotels but was so dissappointed I felt I had better warn other people!!!! Sorry if anyone has booked into this hotel I would re-consider if you can.

Reviews.Title: “you have to be a midget to get into the shower”
Reviews.Author: jmilan
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very old style and needs to be re-done. the location is ok but a far walk to shopping-close to the train station. Front desk check in was very cold, porter insisted taking out bag up-we had one bag as we there for one night-kind of annoying. The room itself was smallish but not bad--we had a view of scaffolding--however the bathroom...you need to be 3 feet tall to use the shower and be very very skinny-you could not move in the shower it was so small and no place for soap or shampoo really shameful for a 4 star hotel. Breakfast was ok-we ate in the room-the usual continental breakfast. we checked out and nobody said goodbye or thank you..

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 24butterfly
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the posts, I was a bit apprehensive to stay here again. However, the apprehension was unfounded. The hotel staff was friendly, and thanks to the previous poster who said something about room 540--my face light up when the concierge told us that's where we were staying!! This is an old world hotel, at least 100 years old. She must have been something in her day. Beautiful lobby, air-conditioned and we were welcomed everytime we came back. We had dinner there in the garden the last night we were there and there was a wedding going on. Yes the floors (wooden) creak, the walls are thin, but we had no problem. THe room was always cleaned and made up by the time we got back. Breakfast was ok--I don't require much in the am--breakfast meats, fruit, coffee, (they'll even bring you cappucino if you ask) bfast cakes, juice, water, cereal, yogurt. If you are looking for an "American Style" hotel, this is not it. We've stayed here b4 this trip, and if we'were going back to Rome, would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. Loved our room....so romantic. Such good value and wonderful staff....will definitely return. A+

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel May 2005 for 5 nights in a standard double room - we did request a garden view room. Room was great very spacious with two very comfy chairs, The bathroom was huge with lovely soft towels and bath robes - all very clean. The garden view was well worth it rather than the main road!!! On the down side the staff were po-faced. Breakfast was just adequate and got stuck in the lift for 15 minutes!! only a bell to attract attention no phone in it - so beware if lift anxious. Having said that would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Quirinale Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale 7, 00184 Rome, Italy
